paragraph: The gross form seemed to consider, then directed his next words not to Solo but to his hirelings. “Put your blasters away.” His gaze and a predatory smile turned to the wary Corellian.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Han, my boy, I’m only doing this because you're the best and I'll need you again sometime. So, out of the greatness of my soul and a forgiving heart—and for an extra, say, twenty percent—I’ll give you a little more time.” The voice nearly cracked with restraint. “But this is the last time. If you disappoint me again, if you trample my generosity in your mocking laughter, Pl put a price on your head so large you won’t beable to go near a civilized system for the rest of your life, because on every one your name and face will be known to men who'll gladly cut your guts out for one-tenth of what I'll promise them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m glad we both have my best interests at heart,” replied Solo pleasantly as he and Chewbacca started

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: past the staring eyes of the Hut’s hired guns, “Don’t worry, Jabba, Til pay you. But not because you threaten me. I'll pay you because . . . it’s my pleasure.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They're starting to search the spaceport central,” the Commander declared, having to alternately run a couple of steps and then walk to keep pace with the long strides of Darth Vader. The Dark Lord was deep in thought as he strode down one of the battle station’s main corridors, trailed by several aides.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The reports are just starting to come in,” the ComMander went on. “It’s only a matter of time before wehave those ’droids.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Send in more men if you have to. Never mind the protests of the planetary Governor—I must have those ‘droids. It’s her hope of that data being used against us that is the pillar of her resistance to the mind probes.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I understand, Lord Vader. Until then we must waste our time with Governor Tarkin’s foolish plan to break her.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There’s docking bay ninety-four,” Luke told Kenobi and the robots who had rejoined them, “and there’s Chewbacca. He seems excited about something.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Indeed, the big Wookie was waving over the heads of the crowd and jabbering loudly in their direction. Speeding their pace, none of the foursome noticed the small, dark-clad thing that had followed them from the transporter lot.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The creature moved into the doorway and pulled a tiny transmitter from a pouch concealed by its multifold robes. The transmitter looked far too new andmoder to be in the grasp of so decrepit a specimen, yet its manipulator was speaking into it with steady assurance.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Docking bay ninety-four, Luke noted, was no different in appearance from a host of other grandiosely

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: named docking bays scattered throughout Mos Eisley. It consisted mostly of an entrance rampway and an enormous pit gouged from the rocky soil. This served as clearance radii for the effects of the simple antigrav drive which boosted all spacecraft clear of the gravitational field of the planet.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The mathematics of spacedrive were simple enough even to Luke. Antigrav could operate only when there was a sufficient gravity well to push against—like that of a planet—whereas supralight travel could only take place when a ship was clear of that same gravity. Hence the necessity for the dual-drive system on any extrasystem craft.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The pit -which formed docking bay ninety-four was as shabbily cut and run-down as the majority of Mos Eisley. Its sloping sides were crumbling in places instead of being smoothly fashioned as they were onmore populous worlds. Luke felt it formed the perfect setting for the spacecraft Chewbacca was leading them toward.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That battered ellipsoid which could only loosely be labeled a ship appeared to have been pieced together out of old hull fragments and components dis-carded as unusable by other craft. The wonder of it, Luke mused, was that the thing actually held its shape. Trying to picture this vehicle as spaceworthy would have caused him to collapse in hysteria—were the situation not so serious. But to think of traveling to Alderaan in this pathetic...

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What a piece of junk,” he finally murmured, unable to hide his feelings any longer. They were walk-ing up the rampway toward the open port. “This thing couldn't possibly make it into hyperspace.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi didn’t comment, but merely gestured toward the port, where a figure was coming to meet them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Either Solo had supernaturally acute hearing, or else he was used to the reaction the sight of the Millennium Falcon produced in prospective passengers. “She may not look like much,” he confessedas he approached them, “but she’s all go. I’ve added

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: STAR WARS I11

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: a few unique modifications to her myself. In addition to piloting, I like to tinker. She’ll make point five factors beyond lightspeed.” ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke scratched his head as he tried to reassess the craft in view of its owner’s claims. Either the Corellian was the biggest liar this side of the galactic center, or there was more to this vessel than met the eye. Luke thought back once more to old Ben’s admonition never to trust surface impressions, anddecided to reserve judgment on the ship and its pilot until after he had watched them in operation.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca had lingered behind at the docking-bay entrance. Now he rushed up the ramp, a hairy whirlwind, and blabbered excitedly at Solo. The pilot regarded him coolly, nodding from time to time, then barked a brief reply. The Wookie charged into the ship, pausing only to urge everyone to follow.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We seem to be a bit rushed,” Solo explained cryptically, “so if you'll hurry aboard, we'll be off.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was about to venture some questions, but Kenobi was already prodding him up the ramp. The *droids followed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Inside, Luke was slightly startled to see the bulky Chewbacca squirm and fight his way into a pilot’s chair which, despite modifications, was still overwhelmed by his massive form. The Wookie flippedseveral tiny switches with digits seemingly too big for the task. Those great paws drifted with surprising grace over the controls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A deep throbbing started somewhere within the ship as the engines were activated. Luke and Ben began strapping themselves into the vacant seats in the main passageway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Outside the docking-bay entrance a long, leathery snout protruded from dark folds of cloth, and somewhere in the depths to either side of that imposingproboscis, eyes stared intently. They turned, along with the rest of the head, as a squad of eight Imperial troops rushed up. Perhaps not surprisingly, they

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: headed straight for the enigmatic figure who whispered something to the lead trooper and gestured ta the docking bay.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The information must have been provocative. Activating their weapons and raising them to firingposition, the: troops charged en masse down the docking-bay entrance.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A glint of light on moving metal caught Solo’s eyes as the unwelcome outlines of the first troops showed themselves. Solo thought it unlikely they would pause to engage in casual conversation. His suspicion was confirmed before he could open his mouth to protest their intrusion, as several dropped to their knees and opened fire on him. Solo ducked back inside, turning to yell forward.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Chewie—deflector shields, quick! Get us out of here!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A throaty roar of acknowledgment came back to him

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Drawing his own pistol, Solo managed to snap off a couple of bursts from the comparative safety of the hatchway. Seeing that their quarry was neither helpless nor comatose, the exposed troops dove for cover.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The low throbbing rose to a whine, then to a deafening howl as Solo’s hand came down on the quick-telease button. Immediately the overhead hatchcover slammed shut. ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As the retreating troops raced out of the dockingbay entrance, the ground was trembling steadily. Theytan smack into a second squad, which had just arrived in response to the rapidly spreading emergency call. One of the soldiers, gesticulating wildly, tried to explain to the newly arrived ranking officer what hadhappened back in the bay.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As soon as the panting trooper had finished, the officer whipped out a compact communicator and shouted into it, “Flight deck . . . they’re trying to escapel Send everything you’ve got after this ship.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: All across Mos Eisley, alarms began to sound, spreading out from docking bay ninety-four in concentric circles of concern.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several soldiers scouring one alleyway reacted to the citywide alarm at the same time as they saw the small freighter lift gracefully into the clear blue sky above Mos Eisley. It shrank to a pinpoint before any of them thought to bring a weapon to bear.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke and Ben were already undoing their acceleration straps as Solo walked past them, moving to-ward the cockpit with the easy, loose-limbed stride of the experienced spacer. Once forward, he fell rather than sat in the pilot’s seat and immediately began checking readouts and gauges. In the seat next to him Chewbacca was growling and grunting like a poorly tuned speeder engine. He tured from studying his own instruments long enough to jab a massive finger at the tracking screen.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo gave it a quick glance, then turned irritably to his own panel. “I know, I know . . . looks like two, maybe three destroyers. Somebody certainly dislikes our passengers. Sure picked ourselves a hot onethis time. Try to bold them off somehow until I can finish the programming for the supralight jump. Angle the deflectors for maximum shielding.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: With those instructions he ceased conversing with the huge Wookie as his hands flew over the computer input terminals. Solo did not even turn around when a small cylindrical shape appeared in the doorway behind him. Artoo Detoo beeped a few remarks, then scurried away.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Rear scanners showed the baleful lemon eye of Tatooine shrinking rapidly behind them, It wasn’t rapid enough to eliminate the three points of light that indicated the presence of the pursuing Imperial war-ships.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Although Solo had ignored Artoo, he tumed to acknowledge the entrance of his human passengers. “We've got two more coming in from different angles,”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 114. STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: he told them, scrutinizing the remorseless instrumentation. “They’re going to try to box up before we canjump. Five ships . . . What did you two do to attract that kind of company?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Can’t you outrun them?” Luke asked sarcastically, ignoring the pilot’s question. “I thought you said this thing was fast.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Watch your mouth, kid, or you'll find yourself floating home. There’s too many of ’em, for one thing, But, we'll be safe enough once we’ve made the jump into hyperspace.” He grinned knowingly. “Can’t nobody track another ship accurately at supralightspeeds. Plus, I know a few tricks that ought to lose any persistent stick-tights. I wish I’d known you boys were so popular.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Why?” Luke said challengingly. “Would you have refused to take us?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Not necessarily,” the Corellian replied, refusing to be baited. “But I sure’s hell would’ve boosted your fare.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke had a retort poised on his lips. It was wiped out as he threw.up his arms to ward off a brilliant red flash which gave black space outside the viewport the temporary aspect of the surface of a sun. Kenobi, Solo, and even Chewbacca did likewise, since the proximity of the explosion nearly overrode the phototropic shielding.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Here’s where the situation gets interesting,” Solo muttered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “How long before you can make the jump?” Kenobi inquired easily, apparently unconcerned that at any second they all might cease to exist.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're still within the gravitational influence of Tatooine,” came the cool response. “It will be a few minutes yet before the navigation computer can compensate and effect an accurate jump. I could override its decision, but the hyperdrive would likelyshred itself. That would give me a nice hold full of scrap metal in addition to you four.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ‘““A few minutes,” Luke blurted, staring at the screens. “At the rate they’re gaining...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Traveling through hyperspace isn’t like dusting crops, boy. Ever tried calculating a hyperspace jump?” Luke had to shake his head. “It’s no mean trick. Be nice if we rushed it and passed right through a star or some other friendly spatial phenom like a black hole. That would end our trip real quick.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Fresh explosions continued to flare close by despite Chewbacca’s best efforts at evasion. On Solo’s console a red warning light began to flash for attention.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What’s that?” Luke wondered nervously.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're losing a deflector shield,” Solo informed him with the air of a man about to have a tooth pulled. “Better strap yourselves back in. We’re almost ready to make the jump. It could get bad if we take a nearburst at the wrong moment.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Back in the main hold area Threepio was already locked tightly into his seat by metal arms stronger than any acceleration straps. Artoo swayed back and forth under the concussion produced by increasingly powerful energy bursts against the ship’s deflectors.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Was this trip really necessary?” the tall robot muttered in desperation. “I’d forgotten how much I hatespace travel.” He broke off as Luke and Ben appeared and began strapping themselves back into their chairs.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Oddly, Luke was thinking of a dog he had once owned when an immensely powerful something wrenched at the ship’s hull with the strength of a fallen angel.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Admiral Motti entered the quiet conference room, his face streaked by the linear lights lining the walls. His gaze went to the spot where Governor Tarkin stood before the curved viewscreen, and he bowed slightly. Despite the evidence of the small green gem of a world entered in the screen, he formally announced, “We have entered the Alderaan system.We await your order.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The door signaled and Tarkin made a falsely gentle gesture to the admiral. “Wait a moment yet,Motti.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The door slid aside and Leia Organa entered, flanked by two armed guards, followed by Darth Vader.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T am—,” Tarkin began.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “JT know who you are,” she spat, “Governor Tarkin. I should have expected to find you holding Vader’s leash. I thought I recognized your unique stench when I was first brought on board.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Charming to the last,” Tarkin declared in a fashion which suggested he was anything but charmed.“You don’t know how hard I found it to sign the order for your termination.” His expression changed to one of mock sorrow. “Of course, had you cooperated in our investigation, things might be otherwise. Lord Vader has informed me that your resistance to our traditional methods of inquiry—

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Torture, you mean,” she countered a trifle shakily.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Let us not bandy semantics,” Tarkin smiled.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Ym surprised you had the courage to take the responsibility for issuing the order on yourself.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin sighed reluctantly. “I am a dedicated man, and the pleasures I reserve for myself are few. One of them is that before your execution I should like you to be my guest at a small ceremony. It will certify this battle station’s operational status while at the same time ushering in a new era of Imperial technical supremacy. This station is the final link in the new-forged Imperial chain which will bind the million systems of the galactic Empire together once and for all. Your petty Alliance will no longer be of any concem to us. After today’s demonstration no one willdare to oppose Imperial decree, not even the Senate.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Organa looked at him with contempt. “Force will not keep the Empire together. Force has never kept anything together for very long. The more you tighten your grip, the more systems will slip through your fin-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: gers. You’re a foolish man, Governor. Foolish men often choke to death on their own delusions.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin smiled a death’s-head smile, his face a parchment skull’s. “It will be interesting to see what manner of passing Lord Vader has in mind for you. I am certain it will be worthy of you—and of him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But before you leave us, we must demonstrate the power of this station once and for all, in a conclusive fashion. In a way, you have determined the choice of subject for this demonstration. Since you have proven teluctant to supply us with the location of the rebel stronghold, I have deemed it appropriate to select as an alternate subject your home planet of Alderaan.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No! You can’t! Alderaan is a peaceful world, with no standing armies, You can’t...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin’s eyes gleamed, “You would prefer another target? A military target, perhaps? We're agreeable

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: . name the system.” He shrugged elaborately. “I grow tired of such games. For the last time, where is the main rebel base?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A voice announced over a hidden speaker that they had approached within antigrav range of Alderaan— approximately six planetary diameters, That was enough to accomplish what all of Vader’s infernal devices had failed to.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ‘Dantooine,” she whispered, staring at the deck, all pretense at defiance gone now. “They’re on Dantooine.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin let out a slow sigh of satisfaction, then turned to the black figure nearby. “There, you see, Lord Vader? She can be reasonable. One needs only frame the question properly to elicit the desired response.” He directed his attention to the other officers.“After concluding our little test here we shall make haste to move on to Dantooine. You may proceed with the operation, gentlemen.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It took several seconds for Tarkin’s words, so casually uttered, to penetrate. “What!” Organa finallygasped.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Dantooine,” Tarkin explained, examining his fin-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: gers, “is too far from the centers of Imperial population to serve as the subject of an effective demonstration. You will understand that for reports ofour power to spread rapidly through the Empire we require an obstreperous world more centrally located. Have no fear, though. We will deal with your rebel friends on Dantooine as soon as possible.’

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But you said. . .” Organa started to protest.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The only words which have meaning are the last ones spoken,” Tarkin declared cuttingly. “We will proceed with the destruction of Alderaan as planned. Then you will enjoy watching with us as we obliterate the Dantooine center of this stupid and futile rebellion.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He gestured to the two soldiers flanking her. “‘Escort her to the principal observation level and,” hesmiled, “make certain she is provided with an unobstructed view.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: SOLO was busily checking readouts from gauges and dials in the hold area. Occasionally he would pass a small box across various sensors, study the result, and cluck with pleasure.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You can stop worrying about your Imperial friends,” he told Luke and Ben. “They'll never be able to track us now. Told you I'd lose them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi might have nodded briefly in response, but he was engaged in explaining something to Luke.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Don’t everybody thank me at once,” Solo grunted, slightly miffed. “Anyway, navigation computer .calculates our arrival in Alderaan orbit at oh-two-hundred.Tm afraid after this little adventure Til have to forge a new registration.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He returned to his checking, passing in front of a

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: small circular table. The top was covered with small squares lit from beneath, while computer monitors were set into each side. Tiny three-dimensional figures were projected above the tabletop from various squares.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca sat hunched over one side of the table, his chin resting in massive hands. His great eyes glowing and facial whiskers wrinkled upward, he gave every sign of being well pleased with himself.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At least, he did until Artoo Detoo reached up with a stubby clawed limb across from him and tapped his own computer monitor. One of the figures walked abruptly across the board to a new square and stopped there.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: An expression of puzzlement, then anger crossed the Wookie’s face as he studied the new configuration. Glaring up and over the table, he vented astream of abusive gibberish on the inoffensive machine. Artoo could only beep in reply, but Threepiosoon interceded on behalf of his less eloquent companion and began arguing with the hulking anthropoid.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He executed a fair move. Screaming about it won't help you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Attracted by the commotion, Solo looked back over his shoulder, frowning slightly. “Let him have it. Your friend’s way ahead anyhow. It’s not wise to upset a Wookie.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “TI can sympathize with that opinion, sir,” Threepio countered,“but there is principle at stake here. There are certain standards any sentient creature must hold to. If one compromises them for any reason, including intimidation, then one is abrogating his right to be called intelligent.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I hope you'll both remember that,” Solo advised him, “when Chewbacca is pulling the arms off you and your little friend.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Besides that, however,” Threepio continued without missing a beat, “being greedy or taking advantage.of someone in a weakened position is a clear sign of poor sportsmanship.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That elicited a beep of outrage from Artoo, and the two robots were soon engaged in violent electronic argument while Chewbacca continued jabber-ing at each in turn, occasionally waving at them though the translucent pieces waiting patiently on the board.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Oblivious to the altercation, Luke stood frozen in the middle of the hold. He held an activated lightsaber in position over his head, A low hum came fromthe ancient instrument while Luke lunged and parried under Ben Kenobi’s instructive gaze. As Solo glanted from time to time at Luke’s awkward movements, his lean features were sprinkled with smugness.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No, Luke, your cuts should flow, not be so choppy,” Kenobi instructed gently. “Remember, the force is omnipresent. It envelops you as it radiates from you. A Jedi warrior can actually feel the force as a physical thing.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It is an energy field, then?” Luke inquired.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tt is an energy field and something more,” Kenobi went on, almost mystically. “An aura that at once controls and obeys. It is a nothingness that can accomplish miracles.” He looked thoughtful for a mo-ment.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No one, not even the Jedi scientists, were able to truly define the force. Possibly no one ever will. Sometimes there is as much magic as science in the explanations of the force. Yet what is a magician but a practicing theorist? Now, let’s try again.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The old man was hefting a silvery globe about the size of a man’s fist. It was covered with fine antennae, some as delicate as those of a moth. He flipped it toward Luke and watched as it halted a couple of meters away from the boy’s face.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke readied himself as the ball circled him slowly, turing to face it as it assumed a new position. Abruptly it executed a lightning-swift lunge, only to freeze about a meter away. Luke failed to succumb to the feint, and the ball soon backed off.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Moving slowly to one side in an effort to get around

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: the ball’s fore sensors, Luke drew the saber back preparatory to striking. As he did so the ball darted inbehind him. A thin pencil of red light jumped from one of the antennae to the back of Luke’s thigh, knocking him to the deck even as he was bringing his saber around—too late.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Rubbing at his tingling, sleeping leg, Luke tried to ignore the burst of accusing laughter from Solo. “Hocus-pocus religions and archaic weapons are no substitute for a good blaster at your side,” the pilot sneered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You don’t believe in the force?” asked Luke, struggling back to his feet. The numbing effect of the beam wore off quickly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve been from one end of this galaxy to the other,” the pilot boasted, ‘and I’ve seen a lot of strange things. Too many to believe there couldn’t be something like this ‘force.’ Too many to think that there could be some such controlling one’s actions. I determine my destiny—not some half-mystical energy field.” He gestured toward Kenobi. “I wouldn’t follow him so blindly, if I were you. He’s a clever old man, full of simple tricks and mischief. He might be using you for his own ends.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi only smiled gently, then turned back to face Luke. “I suggest you try it again, Luke,” he said soothingly. “You must try to divorce your actions from conscious control. Try not to focus on anything concrete, visually or mentally. You must Jet your mind drift, drift; only then can you use the force. You have to enter a state in which you act on what you sense, not on what you think beforehand. You must cease cogitation, relax, stop thinking . . . let yourself drift... free... free...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The old man’s voice had. dropped to a mesmerizing buzz. As he finished, the chrome bulb darted atLuke. Dazed by Kenobi’s hypnotic tone, Luke didn’t see it charge. It’s doubtful he saw much of anything with clarity. But as the ball neared, he whirled with amazing speed, the saber arcing up and out in a pe-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: culiar fashion. The red beam that the globe emitted was neatly deflected to one side. Its humming stopped and the ball bounced to the deck, all animation gone.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blinking as if coming awake from a short nap, Luke stared in absolute astonishment at the inert remote,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You see, you can do it,” Kenobi told him. “One can teach only so much. Now you must leam to admit the force when you want it, so that you can learn to control it consciously.” ,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Moving to one side, Kenobi took a large helmet from behind a locker and walked over to Luke. Placing the helmet over his head effectively eliminated theboy’s vision.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I can’t see,” Luke muttered, turning around and forcing Kenobi to step back out of range of the dangerously wavering saber. “How can I fight?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “With the force,” old Ben explained. “You didn’t really ‘see’ the seeker: when it went for your legs the last time, and yet you parried its beam. Try to let that sensation flow within you again.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “IT can’t do it,” Luke moaned. “Ill get hit again.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Not if you let yourself trust you,” Kenobi insisted. none too convincingly for Luke. “This is the only way to be certain you’re relying wholly on the force.” .

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Noticing that the skeptical Corellian had turned to watch, Kenobi hesitated momentarily. It did Luke no good to have the self-assured pilot laugh every time a mistake was made. But coddling the boy would do him no good either, and there was no time for it anyway. Throw him in and hope he floats, Ben instructed himself firmly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Bending over the chrome globe, he touched a control at its side. Then he tossed it straight up. It archedtoward Luke. Braking in midfall, the ball plummeted stonelike toward the deck. Luke swung the saber at it. While it was a commendable try, it wasn’t nearly fast enough. Once again the little antenna glowed. This time the crimson needle hit Luke square on the seat of his pants. Though it wasn’t an incapacitating

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: blow, it felt like one; and Luke Jet out a yelp of pain as he spun, trying to strike his invisible tormentor.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Relax!” old Ben urged him. “Be free. You’re trying to use your eyes and ears. Stop predicting and use the Test of your mind.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Suddenly the youth stopped, wavering slightly. The seeker was still behind him. Changing direction again, it made another dive and fired.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Simultaneously the lightsaber jerked around, as accurate as it was awkward in its motion, to deflect thebolt. This time the ball didn’t fall motionless to the deck. Instead it backed up three meters and remained there, hovering.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Aware that the drone of the seeker remote no longer assaulted his ears, a cautious Luke peeked out from under the helmet. Sweat and exhaustion competed for space on his face.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Did I—?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I told you you could,” Kenobi informed him with pleasure. “Once you start to trust your inner self there'll be no stopping you. I told you there was much of your father in you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Td call it luck,” snorted Solo as he concluded his examination of the readouts.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “In my experience there is no such thing as luck, my young friend—only highly favorable adjustments of multiple factors to incline events in one’sfavor.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Call it what you like,” the Corellian sniffed indifferently, “but good against a mechanical remoteis one thing. Good against a living menace is another.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As he was speaking a small telltale light on the far side of the hold had begun flashing. Chewbacca noticed it and called out to him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo glanced at the board, then informed his passengers, “We're coming up on Alderaan, We'll beslowing down shortly and going back under lightspeed. Come on, Chewie.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Rising from the game table, the. Wookie followed

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: his partner toward the cockpit. Luke watched. them depart, but his mind wasn’t on. their imminent arrival at Alderaan. It was burning with something else, something that seemed to grow and mature at the back of his brain as he dwelt on it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You know,” he murmured, “I did feel something. I could almost ‘see’ the outlines of the remote.” He gestured at the hovering device behind him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi’s voice when he replied was solemn. “Luke, you’ve taken the first step into a larger universe.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dozens of humming, buzzing instruments lent the freighter’s cockpit the air of a busy hive. Solo and Chewbacca had their attention locked on the most vital of those instruments.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Steady . . . stand by, Chewie.” Solo adjusted several manual compensators. “Ready to go sublight ...ready... cut us in, Chewie.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Wookie tumed something on the console before him. At the same time Solo pulled back on acomparatively large lever, Abruptly the long streaks of Doppler-distorted starlight slowed to hyphen shapes, then finally to familiar bolts of fire. A gauge on the console registered zero.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Gigantic chunks of glowing stone appeared out of the nothingness, barely shunted aside by the ship’s deflectors. The strain caused the Millennium Falcon tobegin shuddering violently.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What the—?” a thoroughly startled Solo muttered. Next to him, Chewbacca offered no comment of his own as he flipped off several controls and activated others, Only the fact that the cautious Solo always emerged from supralight travel with his deflectors up —just in case any of many unfriendly folks might be waiting for him—had saved the freighter from instant destruction.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke fought to keep his balance as he made his way into the cockpit, “What’s going on?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're back in normal space,” Solo informed him, “but we've come out in the middle of the worst asteriod storm I’ve ever seen. It’s not on any of our

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: charts.” He peered hard at several indicators. “According to the glactic atlas, our position is correct.Only one thing is missing: Alderaan.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Missing? But—that’s crazy!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I won't argue with you,” the Corellian replied grimly, “but look for yourself.” He gestured out the port. “I’ve triple-checked the coordinates, and there’s nothing wrong with the nav ‘puter. We ought to be standing out one planetary diameter from the surface. The planet’s glow should be filling the cockpit, but— there’s nothing out there. Nothing but debris.” He paused. “Judging from the level of wild energy outside and the amount of solid waste, I'd guess thatAlderaan’s been , . . blown away. Totally.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Destroyed,” Luke whispered, overwhelmed at the specter raised by such an unimaginable disaster. “But —how?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The Empire,” a voice declared firmly. Ben Kenobi had come in behind Luke, and his attention was held by the emptiness ahead as well as the import behind it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No.” Solo was shaking his head slowly. In his own way even he was stunned by the enomnity of what the old man was suggesting. That a human agency had been responsible for the annihilation of an entire population, of a planet itself...

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No... the entire Imperial fleet couldn’t have done this. It would take a thousand ships massing a lot more firepower than has ever existed.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I wonder if we should get out of here,” Luke was murmuring, trying to see around the rims of the port. “If by some chance it was the Empire...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I don’t know what’s happened here,” an angry Solo cursed, “but I'll tell you one thing. The Empire isn’ _

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Muffled alarms began humming Joudly as a synchronous light flashed on the control console. Solo bentto the appropriate instrumentation.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Another ship,” he announced. “Can’t judge the

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: type yet.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “A survivor, maybe—-someone who might know what happened,” Luke ventured hopefully.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ben Kenobi’s next words shattered more than that hope. “That’s an Imperial fighter.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca suddenly gave an angry bark. A huge flower of destruction blossomed outside the port, battering the freighter violently. A tiny, double-wingedball raced past the cockpit port.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It followed us!” Luke shouted.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “From Tatooine? It couldn’t have,” objected a disbelieving Solo. “Not in hyperspace.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi was studying the configuration the tracking screen displayed. “You're quite right, Han, It’sthe short-range Tie fighter.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But where did it come from?” the Corellian wanted to know. “There are no Imperial bases near here. It couldn’t have been a Tie job.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You saw it pass.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I know. It looked like a Tie fighter—but what about a base?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s leaving in a big hurry,” Luke noted, studying the tracker. “No matter where it’s going, if it identifies us we're in big trouble.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Not if I can help it,” Solo declared. “Chewie, jam ‘its transmission. Lay in a pursuit course.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It would be best to let it go,” Kenobi ventured thoughtfully. “It’s already too far out of range.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Not for long.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several minutes followed, during which the cockpit was filled with a tense silence. All eyes were on the tracking screen and viewport.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At first the Imperial fighter tried a complex evasive course, to no avail. The surprisingly maneuverable freighter hung tight on its tail, continuing to make up the distance between them. Seeing that he couldn’t shake his pursuers, the fighter pilot had obviously opened up his tiny engine all the way.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ahead, one of the multitude of stars was becoming steadily brighter. Luke frowned. They were moving fast, but not nearly fast enough for any heavenly ob-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ject to brighten so rapidly. Something here didn’t make sense.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Impossible for a fighter that small to be this deep in space on its own,” Solo observed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It must have gotten lost, been part of a convoy or something,” Luke hypothesized.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo’s comment was gleeful. “Well, he won’t be around long enough to tell anyone about us. We’ll be on top of him in a minute or two.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: . The star ahead continued to brighten, its glow evidently coming from within. It assumed a circularoutline.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He’s heading for that small moon,” Luke murmured. -

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The Empire must have an outpost there,” Solo admitted. “Although, according to the atlas, Alderaan had no moons.” He shrugged it off. “Galactic topography was never one of my best subjects. ’m only interested in worlds and moons with customers on them. But I think I can get him before he gets there; he’s almost in range.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: They drew steadily nearer. Gradually craters and mountains on the moon became visible. Yet there was something extremely odd about them. The craters were far too regular in outline, the mountains far too vertical, canyons and valleys impossibly straight and regularized. Nothing as capricious as volcanic action had formed those features. ~

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That’s no moon,” Kenobi breathed softly. “That’s a space station.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But it’s too big to be a space station,” Solo objected. “The size of it! It can’t be artifical—it can’t!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T have a very strange feeling about this,” was Luke’s comment.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Abruptly the usually calm Kenobi was shouting. “Tum the ship around! Let’s get out of here!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yes, I think you’re right, old man. Full reverse, Chewie.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Wookie started adjusting controls, and the freighter seemed to slow, arcing around in a broad

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: curve. The tiny fighter leaped instantly toward the monstrous station until it was swallowed up by its overpowering bulk.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca chattered something at Solo as the ship shook and strained against unseen forces.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Lock in auxiliary power!” Solo ordered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Gauges began to whine in protest, and by ones and twos every instrument on the control console sequentially went berserk. Try as he might, Solocouldn’t keep the surface of the gargantuan station from looming steadily larger, larger—until it became the heavens.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke stared wildly at secondary installations as big as mountains, dish antennae larger than all of Mos Eisley. “Why are we still moving toward it?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Too late,’ Kenobi whispered softly. A glance at Solo confirmed his concern.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're caught in a tractor beam—strongest one I ever saw. It’s dragging us in,” the pilot muttered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You mean, there’s nothing you can do?” Luke asked, feeling unbelievably helpless.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo studied the overloaded sensor readouts and shook his head. “Not against this kind of power. I’m on full power myself, kid, and it’s not shifting out of course a fraction of a degree. It’s no use. I’m going to have to shut down or we'll melt our engines. But they’re not going to suck me up like so much dust without a fight!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He started to vacate the pilot’s chair, but was restrained by an aged yet powerful hand on his shoul-der. An expression of concern was on the old man’s face—and yet, a suggestion of something somewhat less funereal.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “If it’s a fight you cannot win—well, my boy, there are always alternatives to fighting . . .”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The true size of the battle station became apparent as the freighter was pulled closer and closer. Running around the station’s equator was an artificial cluster of metal mountains, docking ports stretching beckoning fingers nearly two kilometers above the surface.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Now only a miniscule speck against the gray bulk of the station, the Millennium Falcon was sucked toward one of those steel pseudopods and finally swal-lowed by it. A lake of metal closed off the entryway, and the freighter vanished as if it had neverexisted.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader. stared at the motley array of stars displayed on the conference-room map while Tarkin and Admiral Motti conferred nearby. Interestingly, the firstuse of the most powerful destructive machine ever constructed had seemingly had no influence at all on that map, which in itself represented only a tiny fraction of this section of one modest-sized galaxy.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It would take a microbreakdown of a portion of this map to reveal a slight reduction in spatial mass, caused by the disapearance of Alderaan. Alderaan, with its many cities, farms, factories, and towns—and traitors, Vader reminded himself.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Despite his advances and intricate technological methods of annihilation, the actions of mankind remained unnoticeable to an uncaring, unimaginablyvast universe. If Vader’s grandest plans ever came to pass, all that would change.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He was well aware that despite all their intelligence and drive, the vastness and wonder were lost onthe two men who continued to chatter monkeylike behind him. Tarkin and Motti were talented and ambitious, but they saw things only on the scale of hu-man pettiness. It was a pity, Vader thought, that they did not possess the scope to match their abilities.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Still, neither man was a Dark Lord. As such, little more could be expected of them. These two were useful now, and dangerous, but someday they, likeAlderaan, would have to be swept aside. For now he could not afford to ignore them. And while he would have preferred the company of equals, he had to admit reluctantly that at this point, he had no equals.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Nonetheless, he turned to them and insinuated himself into their conversation. “The defense systems on

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Alderaan, despite the Senator’s protestations to the contrary, were as strong as any in the Empire. I should conclude that our demonstration was as impressive as it was thorough.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin turned to him, nodding. “The Senate is being informed of our action at this very moment. Soonwe will be able to announce the extermination of the Alliance itself, as soon as-we have dealt with their main military base. Now that their main source of munitions, Alderaan, has been eliminated, the rest of those systems with secessionist inclinations will fall in line quickly enough, you'll see.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin turned as an Imperial officer entered the chamber. “Yes, what is it, Cass?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The unlucky officer wore the expression of the mouse chosen to bell the cat. “Governor, the advance scouts have reached and circumnavigated Dantooine. They have found the remains of a rebel base... which they estimate has been deserted for some time. Years, possibly. They are proceeding with an extensive survey of the remainder of the system.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin turned apoplectic, his face darkening to a fine pomegranate fury. “She lied! She lied to us!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: No one could see, but it seemed that Vader must have smiled behind his mask. “Then we are even in the first exchange of ‘truths.’ I told you she would never betray the rebellion—unless she thought her confession could somehow destroy us in the process.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Terminate her immediately!” The Governor was barely able to form words.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Calm yourself, Tarkin,” Vader advised him. “You would throw away our only link to the real rebel base so casually? She can still be of value to us.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Fagh! You just said it yourself, Vader: we'll get nothing more out of her. I’ll find that hidden fortress if I have to destroy every star system in this sector. Vu”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A quiet yet demanding beep interrupted him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yes, what is it?” he inquired irritably. A voice reported over an unseen speaker. “Sirs,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: we've captured a small freighter that was entering the remains of Alderaan. A standard check indicates that its markings apparently match that of the ship which blasted its way out of the quarantine at Mos Eisley, Tatooine system, and went hyper before the Imperial blockade craft there could close on it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin looked puzzled. “Mos Eisley? Tatooine? What is this? What’s this all about, Vader?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It means, Tarkin, that the last of our unresolved difficilties is about to be eliminated. Someone apparently received the missing data tapes, learned whotranscribed them, and was trying to return them to her. We may be able to facilitate their meeting with the Senator.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin started to say something, hesitated, then nodded in understanding. “How convenient. I leave this matter in your hands, Vader.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Dark Lord bowed slightly, a gesture which Tarkin acknowledged with a perfunctory salute. Then he spun and strode from the room, leaving Motti looking from man to man in confusion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The freighter sat listlessly in the docking hangar of the huge bay. Thirty armed Imperial troopers stood before the lowered main ramp leading into the ship. They snapped to attention when Vader and a Commander approached. Vader halted at the base ofthe ramp, studying the vessel as an officer and several soldiers came forward.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There was no reply to our repeated signals, sir, so we activated the ramp from outside. We’ve made no contact with anyone aboard either by communicator or in person,” the officer reported.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Send your men in,” Vader ordered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Turning, the officer relayed the command to a noncom, who barked orders. A number of the heavily armored soldiers made their way up the ramp and entered the outer hold. They advanced with appreciable caution.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Inside, two men covered a third as he advanced.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 132. STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Moving in groups of three in this fashion, they rapidly spread through the ship. Corridors rang hollowly under metal-shod feet, and doors slid aside willingly as they were activated.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Empty,” the Sergeant in charge finally declared in surprise. “Check the cockpit.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several troopers made their way forward and slid the portal aside, only to discover the pilot’s chairs as vacant as the rest of the freighter. The controls were deactivated and all systems shut down. Only a single light on the console winked on and off fitfully. The Sergeant moved forward, recognized the source of the light, and activated the appropriate controls. A printout appeared on a nearby screen. He studied it intently, then turned to convey the information to his superior, who was waiting by the main hatch.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That worthy listened carefully before he turned and called down to the Commander and Vader. “There is no one aboard; the ship is completely deserted, sirs. According to the ship’s log, her crew abandoned ship immediately after lift-off, then set her on automatics for Alderaan.” .

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Possibly a decoy,” the Commander ventured aloud. “Then they should still be on Tatooine!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Possibly,” Vader admitted reluctantly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Several of the escape pods have been jettisoned,” the officer went on.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Did you find any ’droids on board?” Vader called,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No, sir—nothing. If there were any, they must have abandoned the ship along with the organic crew.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader hesitated before replying. When he did so, uncertainty was evident in his voice. “This doesn’t feel right. Send a fully equipped scanning team on board. I want every centimeter of that ship checked out, See to it as soon as possible.” With that, he whirled and stalked from the hangar, pursued by the infuriating feeling that he was overlooking something of vital importance.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The rest of the assembled soldiers were dismissed

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: by the officer. On board the freighter, a last lone figure left off examining the space beneath the cockpitconsoles and ran to join his comrades. He was anxious to be off this ghost ship and back in the com-fortable surroundings of the barracks. His heavy footsteps echoed through the once more empty freighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Below, the muffled sounds of the officer giving final orders faded, leaving the interior in complete quiet. The quivering of a portion of the floor was the only movement on board.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Abruptly the quivering became a sharp, upheaval. Two metal panels popped upward, followed by a pair of tousled heads. Han Solo and Luke looked around quickly, then managed to relax a little when it became clear that the ship was as empty as it sounded.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Lucky you'd built these compartments,” Luke commented.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo was not as cheerily confident. “Where did you think I kept smuggled goods—in the main hold? I admit I never expected to smuggle myself in them.” He started violently at a sudden sound, but it was only another of the panels shifting aside.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is ridiculous. It isn’t going to work. Even if I could take off and get past the closed hatch”—he jabbed a thumb upward—“we’d never get past that tractor beam.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Another panel opened, revealing the face of an elderly imp. “You leave that to me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I was afraid you’d say something like that,” muttered Solo. “You’re a damn fool, old man.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi grinned at him. “What does that say of the man who allows himself to be hired by a fool?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo muttered something under his breath as they pulled themselves clear of the compartments, Chewbacca doing so with a good deal of grunting and twist-ing.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two technicians had arrived at the base of the tamp. They reported to the two bored soldiers guarding it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 134. STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The ship’s all yours,” one of the troopers told them. “If the scanners pick up anything, report it immediately.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The men nodded, then strained to lug their heavy equipment up the ramp. As soon as they disappeared inside, a loud crash was heard. Both guards whirled, then heard a voice call, “Hey, down there, could you give us a hand with this?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: One trooper looked at his companion, who shrugged. They both started up the ramp, muttering at the inefficiency of mere technicians. A second crashingsound reverberated, but now there was no one left to hear it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But the absence of the two troopers was noticed, soon thereafter. A gantry officer passing the window of a small command office near the freighter entrance glanced out, frowning when he saw no sign ofthe guards. Concerned but not alarmed, he moved to a comlink and spoke into it as he continued to stare at the ship.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “THX-1138, why aren’t you at your post? THX1138, do you copy?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The speaker gave back only static.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “THX-1138, why don’t you reply?” The officer was beginning to panic when an armored figure descended the ramp and waved toward him. Pointing tothe portion of his helmet covering his right ear, the figure tapped it to indicate the comlink inside wasn’t working.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Shaking his head in disgust, the gantry officer gave his busy aide an annoyed look as he made for the door. “Take over here. We’ve got another bad transmitter. I’m going to see what J can do. He activatedthe door, took a step forward -as it slid aside—and stumbled backward in a state of shock.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Filling the door completely was a towering hairy form. Chewbacca leaned inward and with a bonesplintering howl flattened the benumbed officer withone swipe of a pan-sized fist.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The aide was already on his feet and reaching for

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: his sidearm when a narrow energy beam passed completely through him, piercing his heart. Solo flipped up the faceplate of his trooper helmet, then slid it back into place as he followed the Wookie into the. room. Kenobi and the ‘droids squeezed in behind him, with Luke, also clad in the armor of a luckless Imperial soldier, bringing up the rear.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was looking around nervously as he shut the door behind them. “Between his howling and your blasting everything in sight, it’s a wonder the entire station doesn’t know we’re here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Bring °em on,” Solo demanded, unreasonably enthused by their success so far. “I prefer a straightfight to all this sneaking around.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Maybe you’re in a hurry to die,” Luke snapped, “but I’m not. All this sneaking around has kept us alive.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Corellian gave Luke a sour eye but said noth-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ing. They watched as Kenobi operated an incredibly complex computer console with the ease and confidence of one long accustomed to handling intricatemachinery. A screen lit up promptly with a map of sections of the’ battle station. The old man leaned forward, scrutinizing the display carefully.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Meanwhile, Threepio and Artoo had been going over an equally complicated control panel nearby. Artoo suddenly froze and began whistling wildly at something he had found. Solo and Luke, their momentary disagreement over tactics forgotten, rushedover to where the robots were standing. Chewbacca busied himself hanging the gantry officer up by his toes.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Plug him in,” Kenobi suggested, looking over from his place before the larger readout. “He should be able to draw information from the entire station network. Let’s see if he can find out where the tractor-beam power unit is located.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Why not just disconnect the beam from here, sir?’ Luke wanted to know.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It was Solo who replied derisively, “What, and have them lock it right back on us before we can get a ship’s length outside the docking bay?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked crestfallen. “Oh. I hadn’t thought of that.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We have to break the tractor at its power source in order to execute a clean escape, Luke,” old Ben chided gently as Artoo punched a claw arm into the open computer socket he had discovered. Immediately a galaxy of lights came to life on the panel in front of him and the room was filled with the hum of machinery working at high speed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several minutes passed while the little ‘droid sucked up information like a metal sponge. Then the hum slowed and he turned to beep something back at them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He’s found it, sir!” Threepio announced excitedly,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The tractor beam is coupled to the main reactors at seven locations. Most of the pertinent data is restricted, but he'll try to pull the critical informationthrough to the monitor.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi turned his attention from the larger screen to a small readout near Artoo. Data began to race across it too fast for Luke to see, but apparently Kenobi somehow made something of the schematic blur. “I don’t think there’s any way you boys can help with this,” he told them. “I must go alone.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That suits me fine,” said Solo readily. “I’ve already done more than I bargained for on this trip. But I think putting that tractor beam out of commission’s going to take more than your magic, old man.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke wasn’t put off so easily. “I want to go with

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ou.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: y ‘Don’t be impatient, young Luke. This requires skills you haven’t yet mastered. Stay and watch over the ’droids and wait for my signal. They must be delivered to the rebel forces or many more worlds will meet the same fate as Alderaan. Trust in the force, Luke—and wait.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: With a last look at the flow of information on the

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: monitor, Kenobi adjusted the lightsaber at his waist. Stepping to the door, he slid it aside, looked once left, once right, and, disappeared down a long, glowing hallway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As soon as he was gone Chewbacca growled and Solo nodded agreement. “You said it, Chewie!l” He turned to Luke. “Where’d you dig up that old fossil?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Ben Kenobi—General Kenobi—is a great man,” Luke protested loftily.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Great at getting us into trouble,” Solo snorted. “ ‘General,’ my afterburmers! He’s not going to get us out of here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You got any better ideas?” Luke shot back challengingly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Anything would be better than just waiting here for them to come and pick us up. If we—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A hysterical whistling and hooting came from the computer console. Luke hurried over to Artoo Detoo. The little "droid was all but hopping about on stubby legs.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What now?” Luke asked Threepio.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The taller robot looked puzzled himself. “I’m afraid I don’t understand either, sir. He says, ‘I found her,’ and keeps repeating, ‘She’s here, she’s here!’ ”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Who? Who has he found?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Artoo turned a flat blinking face toward Luke and whistled frantically.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Princess Leia,” Threepio announced after listening carefully, “Senator Organa—they seem to be one and the same. I believe she may be the person in the message he was carrying.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That three-dimensional portrait of indescribable beauty coalesced in Luke’s mind again, “The Princess? She’s here?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Attracted by the commotion, Solo wandered over. “Princess? What’s going on?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Where? Where is she?” Luke demanded breathlessly, ignoring Solo completely.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Artoo whistled on while Threepio translated. “Level

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: five, detention block AA-23. According to the information, she is scheduled for slow termination.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No! We’ve got to do something.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What are you three blabbering about?” an exasperated Solo demanded.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “She’s the one who programmed the message into Artoo Detoo,” Luke explained hurriedly, “the one we were trying to deliver to Alderaan. We’ve got to help her.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Now, just a minute,” Solo cautioned him. “This is going awful fast for me. Don’t get any funny ideas. When I said I didn’t have any ‘better ideas’ I meant it. The old man said to wait here. I don’t like it, but I’m not going off on some crazy maze through this place.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But Ben didn’t know she was here,” Luke half pleaded, half argued. “I’m sure that if he knew he would have changed his plans.” Anxiety turned to thoughtfulness. “Now, if we could just figure a way to get into that detention block . . .”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo shook his head and stepped back. “Huh-uh— Tm not going into any Imperial detention blocks.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “If we don’t do something, they’re going to execute her. A minute ago you said you didn’t just want to sit here and wait to be captured, Now all you want to do is stay. Which is it, Han?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Corellian looked troubled—and confused. “Marching into a detention area’s not what I had in mind. We're likely to end up there anyway—why rush it?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But they’re going to execute her!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Better her than me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Where’s your sense of chivalry, Han?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo considered. “Near as I can recall, I traded it for a ten-carat chrysopaz and three bottles of good brandy about five years ago on Commenor.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve seen her,” Luke persisted desperately. “She’s beautiful.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “So’s life.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “She’s a rich and powerful Senator,” Luke pressed,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: hoping an appeal to Solo’s baser instincts might be more effective. “If we could save her, the reward could be substantial.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Uh... rich?” Then Solo looked disdainful. “Wait a minute .. . Reward, from whom? From the government on Alderaan?” He made a sweeping gesturetoward the hangar and by implication the space where Alderaan had once orbited.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke thought furiously. “If she’s being held here and is scheduled to be executed, that means she must be dangerous in some way to whoever destroyed Alderaan, to whoever had this station built. You can bet it had something to do with the Empire instituting a reign of full repression.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “TI tell you who'll pay for her rescue, and for the information she holds. The Senate, the rebel Alliance, and every concern that did business withAlderaan. She could be the sole surviving heir of the off-world wealth of the entire system! The reward could be more wealth than you can imagine.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I don’t know . . . I can imagine quite a bit.” He glanced at Chewbacca, who grunted a terse reply. Solo shrugged back at the big Wookie. “All right, we'll give it a try. But you'd better be right about that reward. What’s your plan, kid?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was momentarily taken aback. Af! his energies up till now had been concentrated on persuading Solo and Chewbacca to aid in a rescue attempt. That accomplished, Luke became aware he had no idea how to proceed. He had grown used to old Ben and Solo giving directions. Now the next move was up to him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: His eyes were caught by several metal circlets dangling from the belt of Solo’s armor. “Give me those binders and tell Chewbacca to come over here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo handed Luke the thin but quite unbreakable cuffs and relayed the request to Chewbacca. The Wookie lumbered over and stood waiting next to Luke.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Now, I’m going to put these on you,” Luke be-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: gan, starting to move behind the Wookie with the cuffs, “and—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca made a sound low in his throat, and Luke jumped in spite of himself, “Now,” he began again, “Han is going to put these on you and... .” He sheepishly handed the binders to Solo, uncomfortably aware of the enormous anthropoid’s glowingeyes on him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo sounded amused as he moved forward. “Don’t worry, Chewie. I think I know what he has in mind.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The cuffs barely fit around the thick wrists, Despite his partner’s seeming confidence in the plan, the Wookie wore a worried, frightened look as the testraints were activated.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Luke, sir.” Luke looked over at Threepio. “Pardon me for asking, but, ah—what should Artoo andI do if someone discovers us here in your absence?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hope they don’t have blasters,” Solo replied.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Threepio’s tone indicated he didn’t find the answer humorous. “That isn’t very reassuring.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo and Luke were too engrossed in their coming expedition to pay much attention to the worried robot. They adjusted their helmets. Then, with Chew-bacca wearing a half-reat downcast expression, they started off along the corridor where Ben Kenobi had disappeared,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: AS they traveled farther and deeper into the bowels of the gigantic station, they found it increasingly difficult to maintain an air of casual indifference.Fortunately, those who might have sensed some nervousness on the part of the two armored trooperswould regard it as only natural, considering their huge, dangerous Wookie captive. Chewbacca also

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: made it impossible for the two young men to be as inconspicuous as they would have liked.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The farther they traveled, the heavier the traffic became. Other soldiers, bureaucrats, technicians, and mechanicals bustled around them. Intent on their own assignments, they ignored the trio completely, only a few of the humans sparing the Wookie a curious glance. Chewbacca’s morose expression and the seeming confidence of his captors reassured the in-quisitive.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Eventually they reached a wide bank of elevators. Luke breathed a sigh of relief. The computercontrolled transport ought to be capable of takingthem just about anywhere on the station in response to a verbal command.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: There was a nervous second when a minor official raced to get aboard. Solo gestured sharply, and the other, without voicing a protest, shifted to the next elevator tube in line.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke studied the operating panel, then tried to sound at once knowledgeable and important as he spoke into the pickup grid. Instead, he sounded nervous and scared, but the elevator was a pure-responsemechanism, not programmed to differentiate the appropriateness of emotions conveyed vocally. So thedoor slid shut and they were on their way. After what felt like hours but was in reality only minutes, the door opened and they stepped out into the security area,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It had been Luke’s hope they would discover something like the old-fashioned barred cells of the kindused on Tatooine in towns like Mos Eisley. Instead, they saw only narrow ramps bordering a bottomless ventilation shaft. These walkways, several levelsof them, ran parallel to smooth curving walls which held faceless detention cells. Alert-looking guards and energy gates seemed to be everywhere they looked.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Uncomfortably aware that the longer they stood

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: frozen in place, the sooner someone was bound to

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: come over and ask unanswerable questions, Luke searched frantically for a course of action.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This isn’t going to work,” Solo whispered, leaning toward him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Why didn’t you say so before?” a frustrated, frightened Luke shot back,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T think I did, I—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Shssh!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo shut up as Luke’s worst fears were realized. A tall, grim-looking officer approached them. He frowned as he examined the silent Chewbacca.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Where are you two going with this—thing?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca snarled at the remark, and Solo quieted him with a hasty jab in the ribs. A panicky Luke found himself replying almost instinctively. “Prisoner transfer from block TS-138.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The officer looked puzzled. “I wasn’t notified. PU have to clear it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tuming, the man walked to a small console nearby and began entering his request. Luke and Han hurriedly surveyed the situation, their gaze traveling fromalarms, energy gates, and remote photosensors to the three other guards stationed in the area.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo nodded to Luke as he unfastened Chewbacca’s cuffs. Then he whispered something to the Wookie. An ear-splitting howl shook the corridor as Chewbacca threw up both hands, grabbing Solo’s rifle fromhim.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Look out!” a seemingly terrified Solo shouted. “It’s loose. It'll rip us all apart!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Both he and Luke had darted clear of the rampaging Wookie, pulled out their pistols, and wereblasting away at him. Their reaction was. excellent, their enthusiasm undeniable, and their aim execrable. Not a single shot came close to the dodging Wookie. Instead, they blasted automatic cameras, energy-rate controls, and the three dumbfounded guards.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At this point it occurred to the officer in charge that the abominable aim of the two soldiers was a bit too selectively efficient. He was preparing to jab the

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: general alarm when a burst from Luke’s pistol caught him in the midsection and he fell without a word to the gray deck.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo rushed to the open comlink speaker, which was screeching anxious questions about what was going on. Apparently there were audio as well as visuallinks between this detention station and elsewhere.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
