paragraph: Ignoring the barrage of alternate threats and queries, he checked the readout set in the panel nearby.“We've got to find out which cell this Princess of yours is in. There must be a dozen levels and— Here it is. Cell 2187. Go on—Chewie and Pil bold them here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke nodded once and was racing down the narrow walkway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: After gesturing for the Wookie to take up a position where he could cover the elevators, Solo took a deep breath and responded to the unceasing calls from the comlink.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Everything’s under control,” he said into the pickup, sounding reasonably official. “Situation normal.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It didn’t sound like that,” a voice snapped back in a no-nonsense tone. ‘What happened?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Uh, well, one of the guards experienced a weapon malfunction,” Solo stammered, his temporary officialese lapsing into nervousness. “No problem now—we’reall fine, thanks. How about you?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're sending a squad up,” the voice announced suddenly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Han could almost smell the suspicion at the other end. What to say? He spoke more eloquently with the business end of a pistol.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Negative—negative. We have an energy leak. Give us a few minutes to lock it down. Large leak—very dangerous.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Weapon malfunction, energy leak . . . Who is this? What’s your operating—?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Pointing his pistol at the panels, Solo blew the instrumentation to silent scraps. “It was a dumb con-versation anyway,” he murmured. Turning, he shouted

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: down the corridor, “Hurry it up, Luke! We're going to have company.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke heard, but he was absorbed in running from one cell to the next and studying the numbers glowing above each doorway, The cell 2187, it appeared,did not exist. But it did, and he found it just as he was about to give up and try the next level down.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: For a long moment he examined the featureless convex metal wall. Turning his pistol to maximum andhoping it wouldn’t melt in his hand before it broke through, he opened fire on the door. When the weapon became too hot to hold, he tossed it from hand to hand. As he did so the smoke had time to clear, and he saw with some surprise that the door had been blown away.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Peering through the smoke with an uncomprehending look on her face was the young woman whoseportrait Artoo Detoo had projected in a garage on Tatooine several centuries ago, or so it seemed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: She was even more beautiful than her image, Luke decided, staring dazedly at her. “You’re even—more beautiful—than I—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Her look of confusion and uncertainty was replaced by first puzzlement and then impatience. “Aren’t you a little short for a storm trooper?” she finally commented.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What? Oh—the uniform.” He removed the helmet, regaining a little composure at the same time. “I’ve come to rescue you. I’m Luke Skywalker.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T beg your pardon?” she said politely.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I said, I’ve come to rescue you. Ben Kenobi is with me. We've got your two ’droids—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The uncertainty was instantly replaced by hope at the mention of the oldster’s name. “Ben Kenobi!” She looked around Luke, ignoring him as she searched for the Jedi. “Where is he? Obi-wan!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Governor Tarkin watched as Darth Vader paced rapidly back and forth in the otherwise empty conference room. Finally the Dark Lord paused, glancing

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: around as though a great bell only he could hear had rung somewhere close by.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He is here,” Vader stated unemotionally.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Tarkin looked startled. ““Obi-wan Kenobi! That’s impossible. What makes you think so?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “A stirring in the force, of a kind I’ve felt only in the presence of my old master. It is unmistakable.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Surely—surely he must be dead by now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader hesitated, his assurance suddenly gone. “Perhaps . . . It is gone now. It was only a brief sensa-tion.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The Jedi are extinct,” declared Tarkin positively. “Their fire was quenched decades ago. You, my friend, are all that’s left of their ways.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A comlink buzzed softly for attention. “Yes?” Tarkin acknowledged. .

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We have an emergency alert in detention block AA-23.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The Princess!” Tarkin yelped, jumping to his feet. Vader whirled, trying to stare through the walls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I knew it—Obi-wan is here. I knew I could not mistake a stirring in the force of such power.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Put all sections on alert,” Tarkin ordered through the comlink. Then he turned to stare at Vader. “If you're right, he must not be allowed to escape.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Escape may not be Obi-wan Kenobi’s intention,” Vader replied, struggling to control his emotions. “He is the last of the Jedi—and the greatest. The danger he presents to us must not be underestimated—yet only I can deal with him.” His head snapped around to stare fixedly at Tarkin. “Alone.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke and Leia had started back up the corridor when a series of blinding explosions ripped the walkway ahead of them, Several troopers had tried comingthrough the elevator, only to be crisped one after another by Chewbacca. Disdaining the elevators, they.had blasted a gaping hole through a wall. The opening was too large for Solo and the Wookie to cover com-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: pletely. In twos and threes, the Imperials were working their way into the detention block.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Retreating down the walkway, Han and Chewbacca encountered Luke and the Princess. “We can’t go back that way!” Solo told them, his face flushed with excitement and worry.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No, it looks like you’ve managed to cut off our only escape route,” Leia agreed readily. “This is a detention area, you know. They don’t build them withmultiple exits.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Breathing heavily, Solo turned to look her up and down. “Begging your forgiveness, Your Highness,” he said sarcastically, “but maybe you’d prefer it back in your cell?” She looked away, her face impassive.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There’s got to be another way out,” Luke muttered, pulling a small transmitter unit from his beltand carefully adjusting the frequency: “See Threepio... See Threepiol”’

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A familiar voice responded with gratifying speed. “Yes, sit?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We've been cut off here. Are there any other ways out of the detention area—anything at all?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Static crackled over the tiny grid as Solo and Chewbacca kept the Imperial troops bottled up at the otherend of the walkway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What was that ...? I didn’t copy.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Back in the gantry office Artoo Detoo beeped and whistled frantically as Threepio adjusted controls, fighting to clear the awkward transmission. “TI said, all sys-tems have been alerted to your presence, sir. The main entry seems to be the only way in or out of the cell block.” He pressed instruments, and the view on the nearby readouts changed steadily. “All other information on your section is restricted.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Someone began banging on the locked door to the office—evenly at first and then, when no response was forthcoming from within, more insistently.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Oh, no!” Threepio groaned.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The smoke in the cell corridor was now so intense that it was difficult for Solo and Chewbacca to pick

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: their targets. That was fortunate inasmuch as they were now badly outnumbered and the smoke confused the Imperials’ fire with equal thoroughness.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Every so often one of the soldiers would attempt to move closer, only to stand exposed as he penetrated the smoke. Under the accurate fire of the twosmugglers, he would rapidly join the accumulating mass of motionless figures on the rampway flooring.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Energy bolts continued to ricochet wildly through the block as Luke moved close to Solo.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ““There isn’t any other way out.” he yelled over the deafening roar of concentrated fire.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Well, they’re closing in on us. What do we do now?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is some rescue,” an irritated voice complained from behind them, Both men turned to see a thoroughly disgusted Princess eyeing them with regaldisapproval. “When you came in here, didn’t you have a plan for getting out?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo nodded toward Luke. “He’s the brains, sweetheart.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke managed an embarrassed grin and shrugged helplessly. He turned to help return fire, but before he could do so, the Princess had snatched the pistol from his hand,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hey!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke stared as she moved along the wall, finally locating a small grate nearby. She pointed the pistol at it and fired.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo gazed at her in disbelief. “What do you think you're doing?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It looks like it’s up to me to save our skins. Get into that garbage chute, flyboy!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: While the others looked on in amazement, she jumped feet first into the opening and disappeared. Chewbacca rumbled threateningly, but Solo slowly shook his head.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No, Chewie, I don’t want you to rip her apart. [Im not sure about her yet. Either I’m beginning to like her, or I’m going to kill her myself.” The Wookie

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: snorted something else, and Solo yelled back at him, “Go on in, you furry oaf! I don’t care what you smell. This is no time to go dainty on me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Shoving the reluctant Wookie toward the tiny opening, Solo helped jam the massive bulk through. Assoon as he disappeared, the Corellian followed him in. Luke fired off a last series of blasts, more in the hope of creating a covering smoke than hitting anything, slid into the chute, and was gone.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Not wanting to incur further losses in such a confined space, the pursuing soldiers had momentarilyhalted to await the arrival of reinforcements and heavier weapons. Besides, they had their quarry trapped,and despite their dedication, none of them were anxious to die needlessly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The chamber Luke tumbled into was dimly lit. Not that the light was needed to discem its contents. He smelled the decay long before he was dumped into it. Unadorned except for the concealed iluminants, the garbage room was at least a quarter full ofslimy muck, much of which had already achieved a state of decomposition sufficient to wrinkle Luke’s nose.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo was stumbling around the edge of the room, slipping and sinking up to his knees in the uncertain footing in an attempt to locate an exit. All he found was a small, thick hatchway which he grunted and heaved to pry open. The hatchcover refused to budge.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The garbage chute was a wonderful idea,” he told the Princess sardonically, wiping the sweat from his forehead. “What an incredible smell you’ve discovered. Unfortunately, we can’t ride out of here on adrifting odor, and there doesn’t seem to be any other exit. Unless I can get this hatch open.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Stepping back, he pulled his pistol and fired at the cover. The bolt promptly went howling around the room as everyone sought cover in the garbage. A last glance and the bolt detonated almost on top of them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Looking less dignified by the moment, Leia was the first to emerge from the pungent cover. “Put that

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: thing away,” she told Solo grimly, “or you’re going to get us all killed.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yes, Your Worship,” Solo muttered in snide supplication. He made no move to reholster his weaponas he glanced back up toward the open chute above. “It won’t take long for them to figure out what happened to us. We had things well under control—untilyou led us down here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Sure you did,” she shot back, brushing refuse from her hair and shoulders. “Oh, well, it could be worse. ...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As if in reply, a piercing, horrible moaning filled the room. It seemed to come from somewhere beneath them. Chewbacca let out a terrified yowl of hisown and tried to flatten himself against a wall. Luke drew his own pistol and peered hard at various clumps of debris, but saw nothing.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What was that?” Solo asked.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m not too sure.” Luke suddenly jumped, looking down and behind him. “Something just moved past me, I think. Watch out—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: With shocking suddenness Luke disappeared straight down into the garbage.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s got Luke!” the Princess shouted. “It took him under!” Solo looked around frantically for something to shoot at.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As abruptly as he had vanished, Luke reappeared —and so did part of something else. A thick whitish tentacle was wrapped tight around his throat.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Shoot it, kill it!’ Luke screamed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Shoot it! I can’t even see it,” Solo protested.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once again Luke was sucked under by whatever that gruesome appendage was attached to. Solo stared helplessly around the multicolored surface.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: There was a distant rumble of heavy machinery, and two opposing walls of the chamber moved inward several centimeters. The rumble ceased and then it was quiet again. Luke appeared unexpectedly close to Solo, scrabbling his way clear of the suffocating mess and rubbing at the welt on his neck,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What happened to it?” Leia wondered, eyeing the quiescent garbage warily.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked genuinely puzzled. “I don’t know. It had me—and then I was free. It just let me go and disappeared. Maybe I didn’t smell bad enough for it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’ve got a very bad feeling about this,” Solo murmured.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Again the distant rumble filled the room; again the walls began their inward march. Only this time neither sound nor movement showed any sign of stopping.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Don’t just stand there gaping at each other!” the Princess urged them. “Try to brace them with something.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Even with the thick poles and old metal beams Chawbacca could handle, they were unable to find anything capable of slowing the walls’ advance. It seemed as if the stronger the object was that they placed against the walls, the easier it was snapped.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke pulled out his comlink, simultaneously trying to talk and will the walls to retreat. “Threepio .. . come in, Threepio!” A decent pause produced no response, causing Luke to look worriedly at his com-panions.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I don’t know why he doesn’t answer.” He tried again. “See Threepio, come in. Do you read?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “See Threepio,” the muted voice continued to call, “come in, See Threepio.” It was Luke’s voice and it issued softly in between buzzings from the small hand comlink resting on the deserted computer console. Save for the intermittent pleading, the gantry office was silent. .

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A tremendous explosion drowned out the muffled pleadings. It blew the office door clean across the room, sending metal fragments flying in all directions. Several of them struck the comlink, sending it flying to the floor and cutting off Luke’s voice in midtransmission.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: In the wake of the minor cataclysm four armed and ready troopers entered through the blown portal. In-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: itial study indicated the office was deserted—until a dim, frightened voice was heard coming from one of the tall supply cabinets near the back of the room.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Help, help! Let us out!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several of the troopers bent to inspect the immobile bodies of the gantry officer and his aide whileothers opened the noisy cabinet. Two robots, one tall and humanoid, the other purely mechanical and threelegged, stepped out into the office. The taller onegave the impression of being half unbalanced with fear.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They’re madmen, I tell you, madmen!” He gestured urgently toward the doorway. “I think they saidsomething about heading for the prison level. They just left. If you hurry, you might catch them. That way, that way!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two of the troopers inside joined those waiting in the hallway in hustling off down the corridor. That left two guards to watch over the office. They totally ignored the robots as they discussed what might have taken place.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “All the excitement has overloaded the circuitry in my companion here,” Threepio explained carefully. “If you don’t mind, Pd like to take him down to Maintenance.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hmmm?” One of the guards looked up indifferently and nodded to the robot. Threepio and Artoohurried out the door without looking back. As they departed it occurred to the guard that the taller of the two ’droids was of a type he had never seen before. He shrugged. That was not surprising on a sta-tion of this size.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That was too close,” Threepio muttered as they scurried down an empty corridor. “Now we'll have to find another information-control console and plug you back in, or everything is lost.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The garbage chamber grew remorselessly smaller, the smoothly fitting metal walls moving toward one another with stolid precision. Larger pieces of refuse

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 152. STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: performed a concerto of snapping and popping that was rising toward a final shuddering crescendo.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca whined pitifully as he fought with all his incredible strength and weight to hold back one of the walls, looking like a hirsute Tantalus approaching his final summit.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “One thing’s for sure,” Solo noted unhappily. “We're all going to be much thinner. This could prove popular for slimming. The only trouble is its permanence.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke paused for breath, shaking the innocent comlink angrily. “What could have happened to Three-pio?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Try the hatch again,” advised Leia. “It’s our only hope.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo shielded his eyes and did so. The ineffectual blast echoed mockingly through the narrowing chamber. ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The service bay was unoccupied, everyone apparently having been drawn away by the commotionelsewhere. After a cautious survey of the room Threepio beckoned for Artoo to follow. Together theycommenced a hurried search of the many service panels. Artoo let out a beep, and Threepio rushed to him, He waited impatiently as the smaller unit plugged the receptive arm carefully into the open socket.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A superfast flurry of electronics spewed in undisciplined fashion from the grid of the little *droid.Threepio made cautioning motions.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Wait a minute, slow down!” The sounds dropped to a crawl. “That's better. They’re where? They what? Oh, no! They'll only come out of there as a liquid!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Less than a meter of life was left to the trapped occupants of the garbage room. Leia and Solo had been forced to turn sideways, had ended up facing each other. For the first time the haughtiness was gone from the Princess’s face. Reaching out, she took Solo’s

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: STAR WARS = 153

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: hand, clutching it convulsively as she felt the first touch of the closing walls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke had fallen and was lying on his side, fighting to keep his head above the rising ooze, He nearly choked on a mouthful of compressed sludge when his comlink began buzzing for attention.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Threepio!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you there, sir?” the ’droid replied. ““We’ve had some minor problems. You would not believe—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Shut up, Threepio!” Luke screamed into the unit. “And shut down all the refuse units on the detention level or immediately below it. Do you copy? Shut down the refuse—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Moments later Threepio grabbed at his head in pain as a terrific screeching and yelling sounded over the comlink.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No, shut them all down!” he implored Artoo. “Hurry! Oh, listen to them—they’re dying, Artoo! I curse this metal body of mine. I was not fast enough. It was my fault. My poor master—all of them... no, no, nol”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The screaming and yelling, however, continued far beyond what seemed like a reasonable interval. In fact, they were shouts of relief. The chamber walls had reversed direction automatically with Artoo’s shutdown and were moving apart again.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Artoo, Threepio,” Luke hollered into the comlink, “it’s all right, we’re all right! Do you read me?We're okay—you did just fine.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Brushing distastefully at the clinging slime, he made his way as rapidly as possible toward the hatchcover. Bending, he scraped accumulated detritus away,noting the number thus revealed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Open the pressure-maintenance hatch on unit 366- 117891.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yes, sir,” came Threepio’s acknowledgment.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: They may have been the happiest words Luke had ever heard.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: LINED with power cables and circuitry conduits that tose from the depths and vanished into the heavens, the service trench appeared to be hundreds of kilometers deep. The narrow catwalk running around oneside looked like a starched thread glued on a glowing ocean. It was barely wide enough for one man to traverse.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: One man edged his way along that treacherous walkway now, his gaze intent on something ahead of himinstead of the awesome metal abyss below. The clacking sounds of enormous switching devices resoundedlike captive leviathans in the vast open space, tireless and never sleeping.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two thick cables joined beneath an overlay panel. It was locked, but after careful inspection of sides, top and bottom, Ben Kenobi pressed the panel cover in a particular fashion causing it to spring aside. A blinking computer terminal was revealed beneath.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: With equal care he performed several adjustments to the terminal. His actions were rewarded when several indicator lights on the board changed from redto blue.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Without warning, a secondary door close behind him opened. Hurriedly reclosing the panel cover, the old man slipped deeper into the shadows. A detachment of troopers had appeared in the portal, and theofficer in charge moved to within a couple of meters of the motionless, hidden figure.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Secure this area until the alert has been cancelled.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As they began to disperse, Kenobi became one with the dark.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca grunted and wheezed, and barely succeeded in forcing his thick torso through the hatch-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: STAR WARS = 155

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: way opening with Luke’s and Solo’s help. That accomplished, Luke turned to take stock of their sur-roundings.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The hallway they had emerged into showed dust on the floor. It gave the impression of not having been used since the station had been built. Probably it was only a repair access corridor. He had no idea where they were.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something hit the wall behind them with a massive thunk, and Luke yelled for everyone to watch out as a long, gelatinous limb worked its way through the hatch and flailed hopefully about in the open corridor. Solo aimed his pistol at it as Leia tried to slip past the half-paralyzed Chewbacca.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Somebody get this big hairy walking carpet out of my way.” Suddenly she noticed what Solo was preparing to do. “No, wait! It’ll be heard!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo ignored her and fired at the hatchway. The burst of energy was rewarded with a distant roar as an avalanche of weakened wall and beaming all but buried the creature in the chamber beyond.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Magnified by the narrow corridor, the sounds continued to roll and echo for long minutes afterward.Luke shook his head in disgust, realizing that someone like Solo who spoke with the mouth of a gunmight not always act sensibly. Until now he had sort of looked up to the Corellian. But the senseless gesture of firing at the hatchway brought them, for the first time in Luke’s mind, to the same level.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Princess’s actions were more surprising than Solo’s, however. “Listen,” she began, staring up at him, “I don’t know where you came from, but I’m grateful.” Almost as an afterthought she glanced back at Luke, adding, “To the both of you.” Her attention turned back to Solo. “But from now on you do as I tell you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo gaped at her. This time the smug smile wouldn’t come. “Look, Your Holiness,” he was finally able to stammer, “et’s get something straight. I take orders only from one person—me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s a wonder you're still alive,” she shot back smoothly. A quick look down the corridor and she had started determinedly off in the other direction.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo looked at Luke, started to say something, then hesitated and simply shook his head slowly. “No reward is worth this. I don’t know if there’s enoughcredit in the universe to pay for putting up with her ...« Hey, slow down!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Leia had started around a bend in the corridor, and they ran swiftly to catch up with her.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The half dozen troops milling around the entrance to the power trench were more interested in discussing the peculiar disturbance in the detention blockthan in paying attention to their present boring duty. So engrossed were they in speculation as to the cause of the trouble that they failed to notice the fey wraith behind them. It moved from shadow to shadow like a night-stalking ferret, freezing when one of the troopers seemed to turn slightly in its direction, moving onagain as if walking on air.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several minutes later one of the troopers frowned inside his armor, turning to where he thought he had sensed a movement near the opening to the main passageway. There was nothing but an undefinable something which the ghost-like Kenobi had left behind. Acutely uncomfortable yet understandably un-willing to confess to hallucinations, the trooper turned back to the more prosaic conversation of his fellows.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Someone finally discovered the two unconscious guards tied in the service lockers on board the captured freighter. Both men remained comatose despiteall efforts to revive them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Under the direction of several bickering officers, troopers carried their two armorless comrades down the ramp and toward the nearest hospital bay. On the way they passed two forms hidden by a small opened service panel. Threepio and Artoo went unnoticed, despite their proximity to the hangar.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As soon as the troops had passed, Artoo finished removing a socket cover and hurriedly shoved his sensor arm into the opening. Lights commenced a wild flashing on his face and smoke started issuing from several seams in the small ’droid before a frantic Threepio could pull the arm free.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Immediately the smoke vanished, the undisciplined blinking faded to normalcy. Artoo emitted a few wilted beeps, successfully giving the impression of a human who had expected a glass of mild wine and instead unwittingly downed several gulps of something 180 proof.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Well, next time watch where you stick your sensors,” Threepio chastised his companion. “You couldhave fried your insides.” He eyed the socket, “That’s a power outlet, stupid, not an information terminal.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Artoo whistled a mournful apology. Together they hunted for the proper outlet.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke, Solo, Chewbacca, and the Princess reached the end of an empty hallway. It dead-ended before a large window which overlooked a hangar, giving them a sweeping, tantalizing view of the freighter just below.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Pulling out his comlink and looking around them with increasing nervousness, Luke spoke into the pickup. “See Threepio . . . do you copy?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: There was a threatening pause, then, “I read you, sir. We had to abandon the region around the office.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you both safe?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “For the moment, though I’m not sanguine about my old age. We’re in the main hangar, across from the ship.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked toward the bay window in surprise. “TI can’t see you across the bay—we must be right above you. Stand by. We'll join you as soon as we can.” He clicked off, smiling suddenly at Threepio’s reference to his “old age.” Sometimes the tall *droid. was more hu:aan than people.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Wonder if the old man was able to knock out the

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: tractor,” Solo was muttering as he surveyed the scene below. A dozen or so troopers were moving in and out of the freighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Getting back to the ship’s going to be like flying through the five Fire Rings of Fornax.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Leia Organa turned long enough to glance in surprise from the ship to Solo. “You came here in thatwreck? You’re braver than I thought.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At once praised and insulted, Solo wasn’t sure how to react. He settled for giving her a dirty look as they started back down the hallway, Chewbacca bringing up the rear.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Rounding a comer, the three humans came to an abrupt halt. So did the twenty Imperial troopers marching toward them. Reacting naturally—which is to say,without thinking—Solo drew his pistol and charged the platoon, yelling and howling in several languages at the top of his lungs.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Startled by the totally unexpected assault and wrongly assuming their attacker knew what he was doing, the troopers started to back away. Several wild shots from the Corellian’s pistol initiated complete panic. Ranks and composure shattered, the troopers broke and fled down the passage.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Drunk with his own prowess, Solo continued the chase, turning to shout back at Luke, “Get to the ship. I'll take care of these!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you out of your mind?” Luke yelled at him. “Where do you think you're going?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But Solo had already rounded a far bend in the cortidor and didn’t hear. Not that it would have made any difference.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Upset at his partner’s disappearance, Chewbacca let out a thunderous if unsettled howl and rushed down the hallway after him. That left Luke and Leia standing alone in the empty corridor.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Maybe I was too hard on your friend,” she confessed reluctantly. “He certainly is courageous.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He certainly is an idiot!” a furious Luke countered tightly. “I don’t know what good it'll do us if he gets

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: himself killed.” Muted alarms suddenly sounded from the bay below and behind them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That’s done it,” Luke growled disgustedly. “Let’s go.” Together they started off in search of a way down to a hangar-deck level.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo continued his rout of all opposition, running at top speed down the long hallway, yelling and brandishing his pistol. Occasionally he got off a shot whoseeffect was more valuable psychologically than tactically.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Half the troops had already scattered down various subpassages and corridors. The ten troopers he continued to harry still raced headlong away from him,returning his fire only indifferently. Then they came up against a dead end, which forced them to tum and confront their opponents.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Seeing that the ten had halted, Solo likewise slowed. Gradually he came to a complete stop. Corellian and Imperials regarded one another silently. Several of the troopers were staring, not at Han but past him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It suddenly occurred to Solo that he was very much alone, and the same thought was beginning to seep into the minds of the guards he was confronting. Embarrassment gave way rapidly to anger. Rifles and pis-tols started to come up. Solo took a step backward, fired one shot, then tummed and ran like hell.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca heard the whistle and crump of energy weapons firing as he lumbered lightly down the corridor. There was something odd about them, though:they sounded as if they were coming closer instead of moving away.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He was debating what to do when Solo came tearing around a corner and nearly ran him down. Seeing ten troopers in pursuit, the Wookie decided to reserve his questions for a less confused moment. He turned and followed Solo back up the hallway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke grabbed the Princess and pulled her back into a recess. She was about to retort angrily at his brusque-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ness when the sound of marching feet caused her to shrink back into the darkness with him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A squad of soldiers hurried past, responding to the alarms that continued to ring steadily. Luke looked out at the retreating backs and tried to catch his breath. “Our only hope of reaching the ship is from the other side of the hangar. They already know someone’s here.” He started back down the corridor, mo-tioning for her to follow.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two guards appeared at the far end of the passageway, paused, and pointed directly at them. Turning,Luke and Leia began running back the way they had come. A larger squad of troopers rounded the far bend and came racing toward them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blocked ahead and behind, they hunted frantically for another way out. Then Leia spotted the cramped subhallway and gestured to it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke fired at the nearest. of their pursuers and joined her in running down the narrow passage. It looked like a minor service corridor. Behind them, pursuit sounded deafeningly loud in the confining space. But at least it minimized the amount of fire the troops could concentrate on them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A thick hatchway appeared ahead. The lighting beyond turned dimmer, raising Luke’s hopes. If they could lock the hatch even for a few moments and lose themselves somewhere beyond, they might have a chance of shaking their immediate tormentors.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But the hatch stayed open, showing no inclination to close automatically. Luke was about to let out a shout of triumph when the ground suddenly vanished ahead of him. His toes hanging over nothingness, he flailed to regain his balance, succeeding just in time to nearly go over the edge of the retracted catwalk anyway as the Princess plowed into him from behind.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The catwalk had been reduced to a stub protruding into empty air. A cool draft caressed Luke’s face as he studied walls that soared to unseen heights overhead and plunged to fathomless depths below. The service

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: shaft was employed in circulating and recycling the atmosphere of the station.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At the moment Luke was too frightened and concerned to be angry with the Princess for nearly send-ing them over the edge. Besides, other dangers competed for his attention. A burst of energy explodedabove their heads, sending metal slivers fiying.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I think we made a wrong tum,” he murmured, firing back at the advancing troops and illuminating the narrow corridor behind them with destruction.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: An open hatchway showed on the other side of the chasm. It might as well have been a light-year away. Hunting along the rim of the doorway, Leia located a switch and hit it quickly. The hatch door behind them slid shut with a resounding boom. At least that cut off fire from the rapidly nearing soldiers. It also left the two fugitives balanced precariously on a small section of catwalk barely a meter square. If the remaining section were to unexpectedly withdraw into thewall, they would see more of the battle station’s interior than either wished.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Gesturing for the Princess to move aside as much as possible, Luke shielded his eyes and aimed the pistol at the hatch controls. A brief burst of energy melted them flush with the wall, insuring that no one could open it easily from the other side. Then he turned his attention to the vast cavity blocking their path to the opposite portal. It beckoned invitingly—a small yellow rectangle of freedom.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Only the soft rush of air from below sounded until Luke commenetd, “This is a shield-rated door, but it won't hold them back very long.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We've got to get across there somehow,” Leia agreed, once more examining the metal bordering the sealed doorway. “Find the controls for extending the bridge.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Some desperate searching produced nothing, while an ominous pounding and hissing sounded from behind the frozen door. A small spot of white appeared

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: in the center of the metal, then began to spread and smoke.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They’re coming through!” Luke groaned.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The Princess turned carefully to stare across the gap. “This must be a single-unit bridge, with the controls only on the other side.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Reaching up to the point at the panel holding the unreachable controls, Luke’s hand caught on something at his waist. A frustrated glance downward re-vealed the cause—and engendered a bit of practical insanity.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The cable coiled tightly in small loops was thin and fragile seeming, but it was general military-issue line and would have supported Chewbacca’s weight easily. It certainly ought to hold Leia and himself. Pulling the cable free of the waist catch, he gauged its length, matching it against the width of the abyss. This should span the distance with plenty to spare.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What now?” the Princess inquired curiously.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke didn’t reply. Instead, he removed a small but heavy power unit from the utility belt of his armor and tied one end of the cable around it. Making sure the wrapping was secure, he stepped as close to the edge of their uncertain perch as he dared.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Whirling the weighted end of the cord in increasing circles, he let it arc across the gorge. It struckan outcropping of cylindrical conduits on the other side and fell downward. With forced patience he pulled the loose line back in, then recoiled it for another try.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once again the weighted end orbited in ever greater circles, and again he flung it across the gap. He could feel the rising heat behind him as he let it go, heat from the melting metal doorway.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: This time the heavy end looped around an outcropping of pipes above, wrapped itself several timesaround, and slipped, battery end down, into a crack between them. Leaning backward, he tugged and pulled on the cable, pulling on it at the same time as he tried

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: to rest all his weight on it. The cable showed no sign of parting.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Wrapping the other end of the line several times around his waist and right arm, he reached out and pulled the Princess close to him with the other, The hatch door behind- them was now a molten white, and liquid metal was running steadily from its borders.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something warm and pleasant touched Luke’s lips, alerting every nerve in his body. He looked down in shock at the Princess, his mouth still tingling from the kiss.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Just for luck,” she murmured with a slight, almost embarrassed smile as she put her arms around him. “We're going to need it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Gripping the thin cable as tightly as possible with his left hand, Luke put his right over it, took a deep breath, and jumped out into air. If he had miscalculated the degree of arc in their swing, theywould miss the open hatch and slam into the metal wall to either side or below it. If that happened he doubted he could maintain his grip on the rope.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The heart-halting transit was accomplished in less time than that thought, In a moment Luke was on the other side, scrambling on his knees to make sure they didn’t fall back into the pit. Leia released her hold on him with admirable timing. She rolled forward and into the open hatchway, climbing gracefully to her feet as Luke fought to untangle himself from the cable.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A distant whine became a loud hiss, then a groan as the hatch door on the other side gave way. It collapsed inward and tumbled into the depths. If ittouched bottom, Luke didn’t hear it.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A few bolts struck the wall nearby. Luke turned his own weapon on the unsuccessful troopers and returned the fire even as Leia was pulling him into the passageway behind.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once clear of the door he hit the activating switch. It shut tightly behind them. They would have several minutes, at least, without having to worry about being shot in the back. On the other hand, Luke didn’t have

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: the slightest idea where they were, and he found himself wondering what had happened to Han and Chew-bacca,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo and his Wookie partner had succeeded in shaking a portion of their pusuers. But it seemed thatwhenever they slipped free of several soldiers, more appeared to take their place. No question about it: the word was out on them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ahead, a series of shield doors was beginning to close.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hurry, Chewie!” Solo urged.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca grunted once, breathing like an overused engine. Despite his immense strength, theWookie was not built for long-distance sprinting. Only his enormous stride had enabled him to keep pace with the lithe Corellian. Chewbacca left a couple of hairs in one of the doors, but both slipped inside just before the five layers slammed shut.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That ought to hold them for a while,” Solo crowed with delight. The Wookie growled something at him, but his partner fairly fluoresced with confidence.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Of course I can find the ship from here—Corellians can’t get lost.” There came another growl, slightly accusing this time. Solo shrugged. “Tocneppil doesn’t count; be wasn’t a Corellian. Besides, I was drunk.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ben Kenobi ducked into the shadows of a narrow passageway, seeming to become part of the metal itself as a large cluster of troopers hurried past him.Pausing to make certain they had all passed, he checked the corridor ahead before starting down it. But he failed to see the dark silhouette which eclipsed the light far behind him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi had avoided one patrol after another, slowly working his way back toward the docking bay holding the freighter. Just another two tums and he should be at the hangar. What he would do then would be

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: fetermined by how inconspicuous his charges had een.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That young Luke, the adventurous Corellian and his partner, and the two robots had been involved in something other than quiet napping he already suspected from the amount of activity he had observedwhile making his way back from the power trench. Surely all those troops hadn’t been out hunting just for him!

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But something else was troubling them, judging from the references he had overheard concerning a certain important prisoner, now escaped. That discovery had puzzled him, until he considered the rest-less natures of both Luke and Han Solo, Undoubtedly they were involved in some fashion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ben sensed something directly ahead and slowed cautiously. It had a most familiar feel to it, a halfremembered mental odor he could not quite place.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Then the figure stepped out in front of him, blocking his entry to the hangar not five meters away. Theoutline and size of the figure completed the momentary puzzle. It was the maturity of the mind be hadsensed that had temporarily confused him. His hand moved naturally to the hilt of his deactivated saber.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I have been waiting a long time, Obi-wan Kenobi,” Darth Vader intoned solemnly. “We meet again at last. The circle has been completed.” Kenobi sensed satisfaction beneath the hideous mask. “The presence Isensed earlier could only have been you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi regarded the great form blocking his retreat and nodded slowly. He gave the impression ofbeing more curious than impressed. “You still have much to learn.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You were once my teacher,” Vader admitted, “and I leamed much from you. But the time of learning has long passed, and I am the master now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The logic that had constituted the missing link in his brilliant pupil remained as absent as before. There would be no reasoning- here, Kenobi knew. Igniting his saber, he assumed the pose of warrior-ready, a

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: movement accomplished with the ease and elegance of a dancer.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Rather roughly, Vader imitated the movement. Several minutes followed without motion as the two menremained staring at each other, as if waiting for some proper, as yet unspoken signal.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi blinked once, shook his head, and tried to clear his eyes, which had begun to water slightly. Sweat beaded up on his forehead, and his eyelids fluttered again.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Your powers are weak,” Vader noted emotionlessly. “Old man, you should never have come back. It will make your end less peaceful than you might have wished.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You sense only a part of the force, Darth,” Kenobi murmured with the assurance of one to whom death is merely another sensation, like sleeping or making love or touching a candle. “As always, you perceive its reality as little as a utensil perceives the taste of food.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Executing a move of incredible swiftness for one so old, Kenobi lunged at the massive shape. Vader blocked the stab with equal speed, riposting with a counterslash that Kenobi barely parried. Another parry and Kenobi countered again, using this opportunity to move around the towering Dark Lord.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: They continued to trade blows, with the old man now backing toward the hangar. Once, his saber and Vader’s locked, the interaction of the two energy fields producing a violent sparking and flashing. A low buzzing sound rose from the straining power units as each saber sought to override the other.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Threepio peeked around the entrance to the docking bay, worriedly counting the number of troopersmilling around the deserted freighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Where could they be? Oh, oh.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He ducked back out of sight just as one of the guards glanced in his direction. A second, more cautious appraisal was more rewarding. It revealed Han

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo and Chewbacca hugging the wall of another tunnel on the far side of the bay.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo also was nonplussed at the number of guards. He muttered, “Didn’t we just leave this party?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca grunted, and both turned, only-to relax and lower their weapons at the sight of Luke andthe Princess.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What kept you?” Solo quipped mirthlessly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We ran into,” Leia explained, panting heavily, “some old friends.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was staring at the freighter. “Is the ship all right?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Seems okay,” was Solo’s analysis. “It doesn’t look like they’ve removed anything or disturbed her engines. The problem’s going to be getting to it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Leia suddenly pointed to one of the opposite tunnels. “Look!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: IHuminated by the flare from contacting energy fields, Ben Kenobi and Darth Vader were backing toward the bay. The fight attracted the attention of others beside the Senator. Every one of the guards moved in for a better view of the Olympian conflict.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Now’s our chance,” Solo observed, starting forward.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: All seven of the troopers guarding the ship broke and rushed toward the combatants, going to the Dark Lord’s aid. Threepio barely ducked aside as they ran past him. Turning back into the alcove, he yelled to his companion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Unplug yourself, Artoo. We're leaving.” As soon as the Artoo unit slipped his sensor arm free of the socket, the two ’droids began to slowly edge out into the open bay.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi heard the approaching commotion and spared a glance back into the hangar. The squad of troopers bearing down on him was enough to show that he was trapped.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader took immediate advantage of the momentary distraction to bring his saber over and down. Kenobi somehow managed to deflect the sweeping blow, at once parrying and turning a complete circle.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You still have your skill, but your power fades. Prepare to meet the force, Obi-wan.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Kenobi gauged the shrinking distance between the oncoming troops and himself, then tured a pitying gaze on Vader. “This is a fight you cannot win, Darth. Your power has matured since I taught you, but I too have grown much since our parting. If my blade finds its mark, you will cease to exist. But if you cut me down, I will only become more powerful. Heed my words.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Your philosophies no longer confuse me, old man,” Vader growled contemptuously, “I am tbe master now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once again he lunged forward, feinting, and then slashing in a deadly downward arc with the saber. It struck home, cutting the old man cleanly in half. There was a brief flash as Kenobi’s cloak fluttered to the deck in two neat sections.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But Ben Kenobi was not in it. Wary of some tricks, Vader poked at the empty cloak sections with the saber. There was no sign of the old man. He had vanished as though he had never existed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The guards slowed their approach and joined Vader in examining the place where Kenobi had stood seconds before. Several of them muttered, and even theawesome presence of the Sith Lord couldn’t keep a few of them from feeling a little afraid.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once the guards had turned and dashed for the far tunnel, Solo and the others started for the starship —until Luke saw Kenobi cut in two. Instantly he shifted direction and was moving toward the guards.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Ben!” he screamed, firing wildly toward the troops. Solo cursed, but turned to fire in support of Luke. ~

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: One of the energy bolts struck the safety release on the tunnel blast door. The emergency hold broken, the heavy door fairly exploded downward. Both the guards and Vader leaped clear—the guards into the bay and Vader backward, to the opposite side of the door.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo had tumed and started for the entrance to the ship, but he paused as he saw Luke running toward the guards.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s too late!” Leia yelled at him. “It’s over.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No!” Luke half shouted, half sobbed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A familiar, yet different voice rang in his ears—Ben’s voice. “Luke ., . listen!” was all it said.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Bewildered, “Luke turned to hunt for the source of that admonition, He only saw Leia beckoning to him as she followed Artoo and Threepio up the ramp.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Come on! There’s no time.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Hesitating, his mind still on that imagined voice (or was it imagined?), a confused Luke took aim and felled several soldiers before he, too, whirled and retreated into the freighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: DAZED, Luke staggered toward the front of the ship. He barely noticed the sound of energy bolts, too weak to penetrate the ship’s deflectors, exploding harmlessly outside. His own safety was currently of little concern to him. With misty eyes he stared as Chewbacca and Solo adjusted controls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I hope that old man managed to knock out that tractor beam,” the Corellian was saying, “or this is going to be a very short ride.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ignoring him, Luke returned to the hold area and slumped into a seat, his head falling into his hands. Leia Organa regarded him quietly for a while, then removed her cloak. Moving to him, she placed it gently around his shoulders.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There wasn’t anything you could have done,” she whispered comfortingly. “It was all over in an instant.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I can’t believe he’s gone,” came Luke’s reply, his voice a ghost of a whisper. “I can’t.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo shifted a lever, staring nervously ahead. But the massive bay door was constructed to respond to the approach of any vessel. The safety feature now served to facilitate their escape as the freighter slipped quickly past the still-opening door and out into free space.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Nothing,” Solo sighed, studying several readouts with profound satisfaction. “Not so much as an erg of come-hither. He did it, all right.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca rumbled something, and the pilot’s attention shifted to another series of gauges. “Right,Chewie. I forget, for a moment, that there are other ways of persuading us to return.” His teeth flashed in a grin of determination. “But the only way they'll get us back in that traveling tomb is in pieces. Take over.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Whirling, he ran out of the cockpit. “Come with me, kid,” he shouted at Luke as he entered the hold. “We're not out of this yet.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke didn’t respond, didn’t move, and Leia turned an angry face to Solo. “Leave him alone. Can’t you see what the old man meant to him?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: An explosion jarred the ship, nearly tumbling Solo to the deck.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “So what? The old man gave himself to give us a chance to get away. You want to waste that, Luke? You want Kenobi to have wasted himself?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke’s head came up and he stared with vacant eyes at the Corellian. No, not quite vacant . . . There was something too old and unpleasant shining blindly in the back of them. Without a word, he threw off the cloak and joined Solo.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Giving him a reassuring smile, Solo gestured down a narrow accessway. Luke looked in the indicted direction, smiled grimly, and rushed down it as Solo started down the opposing passage.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke found himself in a large rotating bubble protruding from the side of the ship. A long, wicked-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: looking tube whose purpose was instantly apparent projected from the apex of the transparent hemisphere. Luke settled himself into the seat and com-menced a rapid study of the controls. Activator here, firing grip here . . . He had fired such weapons a thousand times before—in his dreams.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Forward, Chewbacca and Leia were searching the speckled pit outside for the attacking fighters represented by firepricks on several screens. Chewbaccasuddenly growled throatily and pulled back on several controls as Leia let out a yelp.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Here they come.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The starfield wheeled around Luke as an Imperial Tie fighter raced toward him and then swung overhead to vanish into the distance. Within the tiny cock-pit its pilot frowned as the supposedly battered freighter darted out of range. Adjusting his own controls, he swung up and over in a high arc intended totake him on a fresh intercept course with the escaping ship.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo fired at another fighter, and its pilot nearly slammed his engine through its mountings as he fought to avoid the powerful energy bolts. As he did so, his hurried maneuver brought him under and around to the other side of the freighter. Even as he was lowering the glare reflector over his eyes, Luke opened up on the racing fighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca was alternating his attention between the instruments and the tracking screens, while Leia strained to separate distant stars from nearby assassins.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two fighters dove simultaneously on the twisting, spiraling freighter, trying to line their weapons on the unexpectedly flexible craft. Solo fired at the descending globes, and Luke followed with his ownweapon a second later. Both fired on the starship and then shot past.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They're coming in too fast,” Luke yelled into his comlink.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Another enemy bolt struck the freighter forward

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 172, STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: and was barely shunted aside by its deffectors. The cockpit shuddered violently, and gauges whined in protest at the quantity of energy they were being asked to monitor and compensate for.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Chewbacca muttered something to Leia, and she murmured a soft reply as if she almost understood.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Another fighter unloosed a barrage on the freighter, only this time the bolt pierced an overloaded screen and actually struck the side of the ship. Though partially deflected, it still carried enough power to blowout a large control panel in the main passageway, sending a rain of sparks and smoke in all directions. ArtooDetoo started stolidly toward the miniature inferno as the ship lurched crazily, throwing the less stable Threepio into a cabinet full of component chips.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A warning light began to wink for attention in the cockpit. Chewbacca muttered to Leia, who stared at him worriedly and wished for the gift of Wookie-gab.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Then a fighter floated down on the damaged freighter, right into Luke’s sights. His mouth moving silently, Luke fired at it. The incredibly agile little vessel darted out of his range, but as it passed beneath them Solo picked it up instantly, and com-menced a steady following fire. Without warning the fighter erupted in an incredible flash of multicolored light, throwing a billion bits of superheated metal to every section of the cosmos.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo whirled and gave Luke a victory wave, which the younger man gleefully returned. Then they turned back to their weapons as yet another fighter stormed over the freighter’s bull, firing at its transmitter dish.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: In the middle of the main passageway, angry flames raged around a stubby cylindrical shape. A fine white powdery spray issued from Artoo Detoo’s head. Wherever it touched, the fire retreated sharply.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke tried to relax, to become a part of the weapon. Almost without being aware of it, he was firing at a fetreating Imperial. When he blinked, it was to see the flaming fragments of the enemy craft forming a

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: perfect ball of light outside the turret. It was his turn to spin and flash the Corellian a grin of triumph.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: In the cockpit, Leia paid close attention to scattered readouts as well as searching the sky for addi-tional ships. She directed her voice toward an open mike.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There are still two more of them out there. Looks like we’ve lost the lateral monitors and the starboard deflector shield.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Don’t worry,” Solo told her, with as much hope as confidence, “‘she’ll hold together.” He gave the walls a pleading stare. “You hear me, ship? Hold together! Chewie, try to keep them on our port side. If we—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He was forced to break off as a Tie fighter seemed to materialize out of nowhere, energy bolts reaching out from it toward him. Its companion craft came up on the freighter’s other side and Luke found himself firing steadily at it, ignoring the immensely powerful energy it threw at him. At the last possible instant before it passed out of range, he swung the weapon’snozzle minutely, his finger tightening convulsively on the fire control. The Imperial fighter turned into a rapidly expanding cloud of phosphorescing dust. The other fighter apparently considered the shrunken odds, turned, and retreated at top speed.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We've made it!” Leia shouted, turning to give the startled Wookie an unexpected hug. He growled at her—very softly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Darth Vader strode into the control room where Governor Tarkin stood staring at a huge, brilliantly lit screen. It displayed a sea of stars, but it was not the spectacular view which absorbed the Governor’s thoughts at the moment. He barely glanced around as Vader entered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are they away?” the Dark Lord demanded. “They’ve just completed the jump to hyperspace. No doubt they are at this very moment congratulating. themselves on their daring and success.” Now Tarkin turned to face Vader, a hint of warning in his tone.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: 174. STAR WARS

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I'm taking an awful chance, on your insistence, Vader. This had better work. Are you certain the homing beacon is secure aboard their ship?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader exuded confidence beneath the reflective black mask. “There is nothing to fear. This will be a day long remembered. It already has been witness to the final extinction of the Jedi. Soon it will see the end of the Alliance and the rebellion.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo switched places with Chewbacca, the Wookie grateful for the opportunity to relinquish the controls, As the Corellian moved aft to check the extent of the damage, a determined-looking Leia passed him in the corridor.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What do you think, sweetheart?” Solo inquired, well pleased with himself. “Not a bad bit of rescuing. You know, sometimes I amaze even myself.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That doesn’t sound too hard,” she admitted readily. “The important thing is not my safety, but thefact that the information in the R-2 ‘droid is still intact.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What’s that *droid carrying that’s so important, anyway?” ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Leia considered the blazing starfield forward. “Complete technical schematics of the battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found. Until then, until the station itself is destroyed, we must go on. This war isn’t over yet.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tt is for me,” objected the pilot. “I’m not on this mission for your revolution. Economics interest me, not politics. There’s business to be done under any government. And I’m not doing it for you, Princess. I expect to be well paid for risking my ship and my hide.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You needn’t worry about your reward,” she assured him sadly, turning to leave. “If money is whatyou love .. . that’s what you will receive.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: On leaving the cockpit she saw Luke coming forward, and she spoke softly to him in passing. “Your

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: friend is indeed a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything—or anybody.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke stared after her until she disappeared into the main hold area, then whispered, “J do... TJ care.” Then he moved into the cockpit and sat in the seat Chewbacca had just vacated.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What do you think of her, Han?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo didn’t hesitate. “I try not to.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke probably hadn’t intended his response to be audible, but Solo overheard his murmur of “Good” none the less,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Still,” Solo ventured thoughtfully, “she’s got a lot of spirit to go with her sass. I don’t know, do you think ‘it’s possible for a Princess and a guy like me... ?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “No,” Luke cut him off sharply. He turned and looked away.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo smiled at the younger man’s jealousy, uncertain in his own mind whether he had added the comment to bait his naive friend—or because it was the truth.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Yavin was not a habitable world. The huge gas giant was patterned with pastel high-altitude cloud formations. Here and there the softly lambent atmospherewas molded by cyclonic storms composed of sixhundred-kilometer-per-hour winds which boiled roll-ing gases up from the Yavinesque troposphere. It was a world of lingering beauty and quick death for any who might try to penetrate to its comparatively small core of frozen liquids.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Several of the giant planet’s numerous moons, however, were planet-sized themselves, and of these, three could support humanoid life. Particularly inviting was the satellite designated by the system’s dis-coverers as number four. It shone like an emerald in Yavin’s necklace of moons, rich with plant and animal life. But it was not listed among those worlds supporting human settlement, Yavin was located too farfrom the settled regions of the galaxy.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Perhaps the latter reason, or both, or a combination of causes still unknown had been responsible for

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: whatever race had once risen from satellite four’s jungles, only to disappear quietly long before the first human explorer set foot on the tiny world. Little was known of them save that they left a number of impressive monuments, and that they were one of the many races which had aspired to the stars only to bave their desperate reach fall short.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Now all that remained were the mounds and foliageclad clumps formed by jungle-covered buildings. Butthough they had sunk back into the dust, their artifacts and their world continued to serve an importantpurpose. ,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Strange cries and barely perceptible moans sounded from every tree and copse; hoots and growls and strange mutterings issued from creatures content to Temain concealed in the dense undergrowth. Whenever dawn broke over moon the fourth, heralding oneof its long days, an especially feral chorus of shrieks and weirdly modulated screams would resound through the thick mist.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Even stranger sounds surged continually from one particular place. Here lay the most impressive of those edifices which a vanished race had raised toward the heavens. It was a temple, a roughly pyramidal struc_ture so colossal that it seemed impossible it couldhave been built without the aid of modern gravitonic construction techniques. Yet all evidencepointed only to simple machines, hand technology— and, perhaps, devices alien and long lost.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: While the science of this moon’s inhabitants had led them to a dead end as far as offworld travel was concerned, they had produced several discoveries which in certain ways surpassed similar Imperial accomplishments—one of which involved a still unex-plained method of cutting and transporting gargantuan blocks of stone from the crust of the moon.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: From these monstrous blocks of solid rock, the massive temple had been constructed. The jungle had scaled even its soaring crest, clothing it in rich green and brown. Only near its base, in the temple

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: front, did the jungle slide away completely, to reveal a long, dark entrance cut by its builders and enlarged to suit the needs of the structure’s present occupants.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A tiny machine, its smooth metal sides and silvery hue incongruous amidst the all-pervasive green, appeared in the forest. It hummed like a fat, swollenbeetle as it conveyed its cluster of passengers toward the open temple base. Crossing a considerable clearing, it was soon swallowed up by the dark maw in thefront of the massive structure, leaving the jungle once more in the paws and claws of invisible squallers and screechers.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The original builders would never have recognized the interior of their temple. Seamed metal had replaced rock, and poured paneling did service for cham-ber division in place of wood. Nor would they have been able to see the buried layers excavated into the tock below, layers which contained hangar upon hangar linked by powerful elevators.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A landspeeder came to a gradual stop within the temple, whose first level was the uppermost of those ship-filled hangars. Its engine died obediently as the vehicle settled to the ground. A noisy cluster of humans waiting nearby ceased their conversation andtushed toward the craft.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Fortunately Leia Organa quickly emerged from the speeder, or the man who reached it first might have pulled her bodily from it, so great was his delight at the sight of her. He settled for giving her a smothering hug as his companion called their own greetings.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You're «safe! We’d feared you’d been killed.” Abruptly he composed himself, stepped away from her, and executed a formal bow. “When we heard about Alderaan, we were afraid that you were .. . lost along with the rest of the population.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “All that is past history, Commander Willard,” she said. “We have a future to live for. Alderaan and its people are gone.” Her voice turned bitter cold, fright-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ening in so delicate-looking a person. “We must see that such does not happen again.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
