paragraph: “We don’t have time for our sorrows, Commander,” she continued briskly. “The battle station has surely tracked us here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo started to protest, but she shut him up with logic and a stern look.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That’s the only explanation for the ease of our escape. They sent only four Tie fighters after us. Theycould as easily have launched a hundred.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo had no reply for that, but continued to fume silently. Then Leia gestured at Artoo Detoo.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You must use the information locked in this R-2 *droid to form a plan of attack. It’s our only hope. The station itself is more powerful than anyone suspected.” Her voice dropped. “If the data does not yield a weakness, there will be no stopping them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was then treated to a sight unique in his experience, unique in most men’s. Several rebel tech-nicians walked up to Artoo Detoo, positioned themselves around him, and gently hoisted him intheir arms. This was the first, and probably the last time he would ever see a robot being carried respectfully by men.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Theoretically, no weapon could penetrate the exceptionally dense stone of the ancient temple, butLuke had seen the shattered remains of Alderaan and knew that for those in the incredible battle station the entire moon would present simply anotherabstract problem in mass-energy conversion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Little Artoo Detoo rested comfortably in a place of honor, his body radiating computer and data-bank hookups like a metal hairdo. On an array of screens and readouts nearby the technical information stored on the submicroscopic record tape within the robot's brain was being played out. Hours of it—diagrams, charts, statistics.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: First the rush of material was slowed and digested by more sophisticated computer minds. Then the most

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: critical information was turned over to human analysts for detailed evaluation.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: All the while See Threepio stood close to Artoo, marveling at how so much complex data could be stored in the mind of so simple a droid.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The central briefing room was located deep within the bowels of the temple. The long, low-ceiling auditorlum was dominated by a raised dais and hugeelectronic display screen at its far end. Pilots, navigators, and a sprinkling of Artoo units filled the seats.Impatient, and feeling very out of place, Han Solo and Chewbacca stood as far away from the stage, with its assemblage of officers and Senators, as possible. Solo scanned the crowd, searching for Luke. Despite some common sense entreaties, the crazy kid had gone and joined the regular pilots. He didn’t see Luke, but he recognized the Princess as she talked somberly with some bemedaled oldster.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: When a tall, dignified gentleman with too many deaths on his soul moved to stand by the far side of the screen, Solo turned his attention to him, as did everyone else in the room. As soon as an expectant silence had gripped the crowd, General Jan Dodonna adjusted the tiny mike on his chest and indicated the small group seated close to him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You alt know these people,” he intoned with quiet power. “They are the Senators and Generals whose worlds have given us support, whether open or covert. They have come to be with us in what may well prove to be the decisive moment.” He let his gaze touch many in the crowd, and none who were so favored remained unmoved.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The Imperial battle station you now all have heard of is approaching from the far side of Yavin and its sun. That gives us a little extra time, but it must be stopped—once and for all—before it can reach this moon, before it can bring its weaponry to bear on us as it did on Alderaan.” A murmur ran through the

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: crowd at the mention of that world, so callously obliterated.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The station,” Dodonna went on, “is heavily shielded and mounts more firepower than half the Imperial fleet. But its defenses were designed to fend off large-scale, capital ship assaults. A small, one- or two-man fighter should be able to slip through its defensive screens.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A slim, supple man who resembled an older version of Han Solo rose. Dodonna acknowledged his presence. “What is it, Red Leader?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The man gestured toward the display screen, which showed a computer portrait of the battle station. “Pardon me for asking, sir, but what good are our snubfighters going to be against that?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dodonna considered. “Well, the Empire doesn’t think a one-man fighter is any threat to anything except another small ship, like a Tie fighter, or theywould have provided tighter screens. Apparently they're convinced that their defensive weaponry can fend off any light attacks.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But an analysis of the plans provided by Princess Leia has revealed what we think is a weakness in the station’s design. A big ship couldn’t get near it, but an X- or Y-wing fighter might.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s a small thermal exhaust port. Its size belies its importance, as it appears to be an unshielded shaft that runs directly into the main reactor system powering the station. Since this serves as an emergencyoutlet for waste heat in the event of reactor overproduction, its usefulness would be eliminated byparticle shielding. A direct hit would initiate a chain reaction that will destroy the station.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: -Mutterings of disbelief ran through the room. The more experienced the pilot, the greater his expressed disbelief.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T didn’t say your approach would be easy,” Dodonna admonished them. He gestured at the screen.“You must maneuver straight in down this shaft, level off in the trench, and skim the surface to—this

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: point. The target is only two meters across. It will take a precise hit at exactly ninety degrees to reach the reactor systematization. And only a direct hit will start the complete reaction.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T said the port wasn’t particle-shielded. However, it is completely ray-shielded. That means no energy beams. You'll have to use proton torpedoes.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A few of the pilots laughed humorlessly. One of them was a teenaged fighter jockey seated next to Luke who bore the unlikely name of Wedge Antilles. Artoo Detoo was there also, seated next to another Artoo unit who emitted 4 long whistle of hopelessness,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “A two-meter target at maximum speed—with a torpedo, yet,” Antilles snorted. ‘“That’s impossible even for the computer.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But it’s not impossible,” protested Luke. “I used to bulls-eye womp-rats in my T-16 back home. They’re not much bigger than two meters.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Is that so?” the rakishly uniformed youth noted derisively. “Tell me, when you were going after your particular varmint, were there a thousand other, what did you call it, ‘womp-rats’ armed with power rifles firing up at you?” He shook his head sadly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “With all that firepower on the station directed at us, this will take a little more than barnyard marksmanship, believe me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As if to confirm Antilles’ pessimism, Dodonna indicated a string of lights on the ever-changing sche-matic. “Take special note of these emplacements. There’s a heavy concentration of firepower on the latitudinal axes, was well as several dense circumpolar clusters.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Also, their field generators will probably create a lot of distortion, especially in and around the trench. I figure that maneuverability in that sector will be less than point three.” This produced more murmurs and a few groans from the assembly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Remember,” the General went on, “you must achieve a direct hit. Yellow squadron will cover for

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red on the first run. Green will cover Blue on the second. Any questions?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A muted buzz filled the room. One man stood, lean and handsome—too much so, it seemed, to be ready to throw away his life for something as abstract as freedom.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What if both runs fail, What happens after that?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dodonna smiled tightly. “There won’t be any ‘after that.’ ” The man nodded slowly, understandingly, and sat down. “Anyone else?” Silence now, pregnant with expectation.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Then man your ships, and may the force be with you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Like oil draining from a shallow pot, the seated ranks of men, women, and machines rose and flowed toward the exits.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Elevators hummed busily, lifting more and more deadly shapes from buried depths to the staging area in the primary temple hangar as Luke, Threepio, and Artoo Detoo walked toward the hangar entrance.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Neither the bustling flight crews, nor the pilots performing final checkouts, nor the massive sparks thrown off as power couplings were disconnected captured Luke’s attention at the moment. Instead, it washeld by the activity of two far more familiar figures.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo and Chewbacca were loading a pile of small strongboxes onto an armored landspeeder. They were completely absorbed with this activity, ignoring the preparations going all around them,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo glanced up briefly as Luke and the robots approached, then returned to his loading. Luke simplywatched sadly, conflicting emotions careening confusedly off one another inside him. Solo was cocky,reckless, intolerant, and smug. He was also brave to a fault, instructive, and unfailingly cheery. The combination made for a confusing friend—but a friendnonetheless. .

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You got your reward,” Luke finally observed, indi-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: cating the boxes. Solo nodded once. “And you're leaving, then?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That’s right, kid. Pve got some old debts to pay off, and even if I didn’t, I don’t think [’d be fool enough to stick around here.” He eyed Luke appraisingly. “You're pretty good in a scrap, kid. Why don’tyou come with us? I could use you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The mercenary gleam in Solo’s eyes only made Luke mad. “Why don’t you look around you and see something besides yourself for a change? You know what’s going to happen here, what they’re up against. They could use a good pilot. But you're turning your back on them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo didn’t appear upset at Luke’s tirade. “What good’s a reward if you’re not around to spend it? Attacking that battle station isn’t my idea of courage—more like suicide.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yeah ... Take care of yourself, Han,” Luke said quietly, turning to leave. “But I guess that’s what you’re best at, isn’t it?” He started back into the hangar depths, flanked by the two ’droids.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo stared after him, hesitated, then called, “Hey, Luke . . . may the force be with you.” Luke looked back to see Solo wink at him. He waved—sort of. Then he was swallowed up by moving mechanics and machinery.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Solo returned to his work, lifted a box—and stopped, to see Chewbacca gazing fixedly at him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What are you staring at, gruesome? I know what I’m doing. Get back to work!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Slowly, still eyeing his partner, the Wookie returned to the task of loading the heavy crates.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Sorrowful thoughts of Solo vanished when Luke saw the petite, slim figure standing by his ship—the ship he had been granted.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you sure this is what you want?” Princess Leia asked him. “It could be a deadly reward.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke’s eyes were filled with the sleek, venomous metal shape. “More than anything.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Then what’s wrong?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked back at her and shrugged. “It’s Han. I thought he’d change his mind. I thought he’d join us.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “A man must follow his own path,” she told him, sounding now like a Senator. “No one can choose it for him. Han Solo’s priorities differ from ours. I wish it were otherwise, but I can’t find it in my heart to condemn him.” She stood on tiptoes, gave him a quick, almost embarrassed kiss, and turned to go. “May the force be with you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I only wish,” Luke murmured to himself as he started back to his ship, “Ben were here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: So intent was he on thoughts of Kenobi, the Princess, and Han that he didn’t notice the larger figurewhich tightly locked on to his arm. He tumed, his initial anger gone instantly in astonishment as he tecognized the figure.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Luke!” the slightly older man exclaimed. “I don’t believe it! How’d you get here? Are you going out with us?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Biggs!” Luke embraced his friend warmly. “Of course I'll be up there with you.” His smile faded slightly. “I haven’t got a choice, anymore.” Then he brightened again. “Listen, have I got some stories to tell you...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The steady whooping and laughing the two made was in marked contrast to the solemnity with which the other men and women in the hangar went about their business. The commotion attracted the attention of an older, war-worn man known to the youngerpilots only as Blue Leader.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: His face wrinkled with curiosity as he approached the two younger men. It was a face scorched by the same fire that flickered in his eyes, a blaze kindled not by revolutionary fervor but by years of living through and witnessing far too much injustice. Behind that fatherly visage a raging demon fought toescape. Soon, very soon, he would be free to let it loose.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Now he was interested in these two young men,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: who in a few hours were likely to be particles of frozen meat floating about Yavin. One of them he Tecognized,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Aren’t you Luke Skywalker? Have you been checked out on the Incom T-65?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Sir,” Biggs put in before his friend could reply, “Luke’s the best bush pilot in the outer-rim tertitories.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The older man patted Luke reassuringly on the back as they studied his waiting ship. “Something to be proud of. I’ve got over a thousand hours in an Incom skyhopper myself.” He paused a moment beforegoing on.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I met your father once when I was just a boy, Luke. He was .a great pilot. You'll do all right out there. If you’ve got half your father’s skill, you'll do a damn sight better than all right.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Thank you, sir. I'll try.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There’s not much difference control-wise between an X-wing T-65,” Blue Leader went on, “anda skyhopper.” His smile turned ferocious. “Except the payload’s of a somewhat different nature.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He left them and hurried toward his own ship. Luke had a hundred questions to ask him, and no time for even one.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T've got to get aboard my own boat, Luke. Listen, you'll tell me your stories when we come back,All nght?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “All right. I told you [’'d make it here someday, Biggs.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You did.” His friend was moving toward a cluster of waiting fighters, adjusting his flight suit. “It’s going to be like old times, Luke. We’re a couple of shooting stars that can’t be stopped!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke laughed. They used to reassure themselves with that cry when they piloted starships of sandhills and dead logs behind the flaking, pitted buildings of Anchorhead ... years and years ago.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once more Luke turned toward his ship, admiring its deadly lines, Despite Blue Leader’s assurances, he

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: had to admit that it didn’t look much like an Incom skyhopper. Artoo Detoo was being snuggled into the R-2 socket behind the fighter cockpit. A forlorn metal figure stood below, watching the operation and shuffling nervously about.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hold on tight,” See Threepio was cautioning the smaller robot. “You’ve got to come back. If you don’t come back, who am I going to have to yell at?” For Threepio, that query amounted to an overwhelming outburst of emotion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Artoo beeped confidently down at his friend, however, as Luke mounted the cockpit entry. Fartherdown the hangar he saw Blue Leader already set in his acceleration chair and signaling to his ground crew. Another roar was added to the monstrous din filling the hangar area as ship after ship activated its engines. In that enclosed rectangle of temple the steady thunder was overpowering.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Slipping into the cockpit seat, Luke studied the various controls as ground attendants began wiring him via cords and umbilicals into the ship. His confidence increased steadily. The instrumentation was necessarily simplified and, as Blue Leader had indicated,much like his old skyhopper.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something patted his helmet, and he glanced left to see the crew chief leaning close. He had to shout to be heard above the deafening howl of multiple engines. “That R-2 unit of yours seems a little beatup. Do you want a new one?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke glanced briefly back at the secured "droid before replying. Artoo Detoo looked like a permanentpiece of the fighter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Not on your life. That ’droid and I have been through a lot together. All secure, Artoo?” The droid replied with a reassuring beep.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As the ground chief jumped clear, Luke commenaced the final checkout of all instruments. It slowlyoccurred to him what he and the others were about to attempt. Not that his personal feelings could override his decision to join them. He was no longer an

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: individual, functioning solely to satisfy his personal needs. Something now bound him to every other man and woman in this hangar.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: All around him, scattered scenes of good-bye were taking place—some serious, some kidding, all with the true emotion of the moment masked by efficiency. Luke turned away from where one pilot left a mechanic, possibly a sister or wife, or just a friend, with asharp, passionate kiss.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He wondered how many of them had their own little debts to settle with the Empire. Something crackled in his helmet. In response, he touched a small lever. The ship began to roll forward, slowly but with increasing speed, toward the gaping mouth of the temple.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: LEIA Organa sat silently before the huge display screen on which Yavin and its moons were displayed. A large red dot moved steadily toward the fourth of those satellites. Dodonna and several other field commanders of the Alliance stood behind her, their eyesalso intent on the screen. Tiny green flecks began to appear around the fourth moon, to coalesce into small clouds like hovering emerald gnats.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dodonna put a hand on her shoulder. It was comforting. “The red represents the progress of the Im-perial battle station as it moves deeper into Yavin’s system.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Our ships are all away,” a Commander behind him declared.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A single man stood alone in the cylindrical hold, secured to the top of a rapier-thin tower, Staring through fixed-mount electrobinoculars, he was the sole

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: visible representative of the vast technology buried in the green purgatory below.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Muted cries, moans, and primeval gurglings drifted up to him from the highest treetops. Some were frightening, some less so, but none were as indicative ofpower held in check as the four silvery starships which burst into view above the observer. Keeping a tight formation, they exploded through humid air to vanish in seconds into the morming cloud cover far above. Sound-shadows rattled the trees moments later, in a forlorn attempt to catch up to the engines which had produced them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Slowly assuming attack formations combining Xand Y-wing ships, the various fighters began to moveoutward from the moon, out past the oceanic atmosphere of giant Yavin, out to meet the technologicexecutioner.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The man who had observed the byplay between Biggs and Luke now lowered his glare visor and adjusted his half-automatic, half-manual gunsights as hechecked the ships to either side of him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue boys,” he addressed his intership pickup, “this is Blue Leader. Adjust your selectors and check in. Approaching target at one point three...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ahead, the bright sphere of what looked like one of Yavin’s moons but wasn’t began to glow with increasing brightness. It shone with an eerie metallicglow utterly unlike that of any natural satellite. As he watched the giant battle station make its way around the rim of Yavin, Blue Leader’s thoughts traveled back over the years. Over the uncountable injustices, the innocents taken away for interrogation and never heard from again—the whole multitude of evils incurred by an increasingly corrupt and indifferent Im-perial government. All those terrors and agonies were concentrated, magnified, represented by the single bloated feat of engineering they were approaching now.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is it, boys,” he said to the mike. “Blue Two, you're too far out. Close it up, Wedge.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The young pilot Luke had encountered in the temple briefing room glanced to starboard, then back to his instruments. He executed a slight adjustment, frowning. “Sorry, boss. My ranger seems to be a few points off. Til have to go on manual.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Check, Blue Two. Watch yourself. All ships, stand by to lock S-foils in attack mode.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: One after another, from Luke and Biggs, Wedge and the other members of Blue assault squadron, the replies came back. “Standing by...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Execute,” Blue Leader commanded, when John D. and Piggy had indicated they were in readiness.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The double wings on the X-wing fighters split apart, like narrow seeds. Each fighter now displayed four wings, its wing-mounted armament and quadruple engines now deployed for maximum firepower and maneuverability.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ahead, the Imperial station continued to grow. Surface features became visible as each pilot recognizeddocking bays, broadcast antennae, and other man-made mountains and canyons.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As he neared that threatening black sphere for the second time, Luke’s breathing grew faster. Automatic life-support machinery detected the respiratory shift and compensated properly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something began to buffet his ship, almost as if he were back in his skyhopper again, wrestling with the unpredictable winds of Tatooine. He experienced a bad moment of uncertainty until the calming voice of Blue Leader sounded in his ears.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Wer’e passing through their outer shields. Hold tight. Lock down freeze-floating controls and switch your own deflectors on, double front.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The shaking and buffeting continued, worsened. Not knowing how to compensate, Luke did exactly what he should have: remained in control and followed orders. Then the turbulence was gone and thedeathly cold peacefulness of space had returned.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “That’s it, we’re through,” Blue Leader told them quietly. “Keep all channels silent until we’re on top of

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: them. It doesn’t look like they’re expecting much resistance.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Though half the great station remained in shadow, they were now near enough for Luke to be able to discern individual lights on its surface. A ship that could show phases matching a moon .. . once again he marveled at the misplaced ingenuity and effort which had gone into its construction. Thousands of lights scattered across its curving expanse gave it the appearance of a floating city.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Some of Luke’s comrades, since this was their first sight of the station, were even more impressed. “Look at the size of that thing!” Wedge Antilles gasped over his open pickup.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Cut the chatter, Blue Two,” Blue Leader ordered. “Accelerate to attack velocity.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Grim determination showed in Luke’s expression as he flipped several switches above his head and began adjusting his computer target readout. Artoo De~too reexamined the nearing station and thought untranslatable electronic thoughts.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Leader compared the station with the location of their proposed target area. “Red Leader,” he called toward the pickup, “this is Blue Leader. We're in position; you can go right in. The exhaust shaft is farther to the north. We'll keep ’em busy down here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Leader was the physical opposite of Luke’s squadron commander. He resembled the popular notion of a credit accountant—short, slim, shy of face.His skills and dedication, however, easily matched those of his counterpart and old friend.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Wer’e starting for the target shaft now, Dutch. Stand by to take over if anything happens.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Check, Red Leader,” came the other’s reply. “We’re going to cross their equatorial axis and try to draw their main fire. May the force be with you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: From the approaching swarm, two squads of fighters broke clear. The X-wing ships dove directly forthe bulge of the station, far below, while the Yships curved down and northward over its surface.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within the station, alarm sirens began a mournful, clangorous wail as slow-to-react personnel realized that the impregnable fortress was actually under organized attack. Admiral Motti and his tacticians had expected the rebels’ resistance to be centered around a massive defense of the moon itself. They were completely unprepared for an offensive response consisting of doz-ens of tiny snub ships.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Imperial efficiency was in the process of compensating for this strategic oversight. Soldiers scrambledto man enormous defensive-weapons emplacements. Servodrivers thrummed as powerful motors aligned the huge devices for firing. Soon a web of annihilation began to develop the station as energy weapons, electrical bolts, and explosive solids ripped out at the on-coming rebel craft.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is Blue Five,” Luke announced to his mike as he nose. dived his ship in a radical attempt to confuse any electronic predictors below. The gray sut-face of the battle station streaked past his ports. “I’m going in.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m right behind you, Blue Five,” a voice Tecognizable as Biggs’ s sounded in his ears.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The target in Luke’s sights was as stable as that of the Imperial defenders was evasive. Bolts flew from the tiny vessel’s weapons. One started a huge fire on the dim surface below, which would burn until the crew of the station could shut off the flow of air to the damaged section.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke’s glee turned to terror as he realized he couldn’t swerve his craft in time to avoid passing through the fireball of unknown composition, “Pull out, Luke, pull out!” Biggs was screaming at him,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But despite commands to shift course, the automatic pressors wouldn’t allow the mecessary cen-trifugal force. His fighter plunged into the expanding ball of superheated gases.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Then he was through and clear, on the other side. A rapid check of his controls enabled him to relax. Passage through the intense heat had been insufficient

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: to damage anything vital—though all four wings bore streaks of black, carbonized testimony to the nearness of his escape. ~

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Hell-flowers bloomed outside his ship as he swung it up and around in a sharp curve. “You all right, Luke?” came Biggs’s concerned query.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T got a little toasted, but ’m okay.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A different, stern voice sounded. “Blue Five,” warned the squadron leader, “you’d better give yourself more lead time or you’re going to destroy your-self as well as the Imperial construction.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Yes, sir. I’ve got the hang of it now. Like you said, it’s not exactly like flying a skyhopper.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Energy bolts and sun-bright beams continued to create a chromatic maze in the space above the station as the rebel fighters crisscrossed back and forth over its surface, firing at whatever looked like a decent target. Two of the tiny craft concentrated on a power terminal. It blew up, throwing lightning-sized electric arcs from the station’s innards.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Inside, troopers, mechanicals, and equipment were blown in ali directions by subsidiary explosions as the effects of the blast traveled back down various conduits and cables. Where the explosion had hulled thestation, escaping atmosphere sucked helpless soldiers and ’droids out into a bottomless black tomb.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Moving from position to position, a figure of dark calm amid the chaos, was Darth Vader. A harried Commander rushed up to him and reported breathlessly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Lord Vader, we count at least thirty of them, of two types. They are so small and quick the fixed guns cannot follow them accurately. They continuously evade the predictors.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Get all Tie crews ‘to their fighters. We'll have to go out after them and destroy them ship by ship.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within numerous hangars red lights began flashing and an insistent alarm started to ring. Ground crews worked frantically to ready ships as flight-suited Imperial pilots grabbed for helmets and packs.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Luke,” requested Blue Leader as he skimmed

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: smoothly through a rain of fire, “let me know when you're off the block.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tm on my way now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Watch yourself,” the voice urged over the cockpit speaker. “There’s a lot of fire coming from thestarboard side of that deflection tower.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tm on it, don’t worry,” Luke responded confidently. Putting his fighter into a twisting dive, hesliced once more across metal horizons. Antennae and small protruding emplacements burst inte transitory flame as bolts from his wing tips struck with deadly accuracy.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He grinned as he pulled up and away from the surface as intense lines of energy passed through spaceTecently vacated. Darned if it wasn’t like hunting womp-rats back home in the crumbling canyons of Tatooine’s wastes.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Biggs followed Luke on a similar run, even as Imperial pilots prepared to lift clear of the station. Withinthe many docking bays technical crews rushed hurTiedly to unlock power cables and conclude desper-ate final checks.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: More care was taken in preparing a particular craft nearest one of the bay ports, the one into which Darth Vader barely succeeded in squeezing his huge frame. Once set in the seat he slid a second set of eye shields across his face.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The atmosphere of the war room back in the temple was one of nervous expectancy. Occasional blinksand buzzes from the main battle screen sounded louder than the soft sussuration of hopeful people trying to reassure one another. Near a far corner of the mass of flickering lights a technician leaned a little closer to his own readouts before speaking intothe pickup suspended near his mouth.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Squad leaders—attention; squad leaders—attention! We've picked up a new set of signals from the other side of the station. Enemy fighters coming your way.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke received the report at the same time as everyone else. He began hunting the sky for the predicted

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Imperial craft, his gaze dropping to his instrumentation. “My scope’s negative. I don’t see anything.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Maintain visual scanning,” Blue Leader directed. “With all this energy flying, theyll be on top of you before your scope can pick them up. Remember, they can jam every instrument on your ship except your eyes.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke tumed again, and this time saw an Imperial already pursuing an X-wing—an X-wing with a number Luke quickly recognized.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Biggs!” he shouted. “You’ve picked one up. On your tail . . ..watch it!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I can’t see it,” came his friend’s panicked response. “Where is he? I can’t see it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke watched helplessly as Biggs’s ship shot away from the station surface and out into clear space, closely followed by the Imperial. The enemy vessel fired steadily at him, each successive bolt seeming to pass a little closer to Biggs’s hull.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He’s on me tight,” the voice sounded in Luke’s cockpit. “I can’t shake him.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Twisting, spinning, Biggs looped back toward the battle station, but the pilot trailing him was persistent and showed no sign of relinquishing pursuit.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hang on, Biggs,” Luke called, wrenching his ship around so steeply that straining gyros whined. “I’m coming in.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: So absorbed in his pursuit of Biggs was the Imperial pilot that he didn’t seee Luke, who rotated hisown ship, flipped out of the concealing gray below and: dropped in behind him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Electronic crosshairs lined up according to the computer-readout instructions, and Luke fired repeatedly. There was a small explosion in space—tinycompared with the enormous energies being put out by the emplacements on the surface of the battle station. But the explosion was of particular significance to three people: Luke, Biggs, and, most particularly, to the pilot of the Tie fighter, who was vaporized with his ship.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Got him!” Luke murmured.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve got one! I’ve got one!” came a less restrained cry of triumph over the open intercom. Luke identified the voice as belonging to a young pilot knownas John D. Yes, that was Blue Six chasing another Imperial fighter across the metal landscape. Bolts jumped from the X-wing in steady succession until the Tie fighter blew in half, sending leaflike glittering metal fragments flying in all directions.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Good shooting, Blue Six,” the squadron leader commented. Then he added quickly, “Watch out, you’vegot one on your tail.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within the fighter’s cockpit the gleeful smile on the young man’s face vanished instantly as he looked around, unable to spot his pursuer. Something flared brightly nearby, so close that his starboard port burst. Then something hit even closer and the interior of the now open cockpit became a mass of flames.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’m hit, ’'m hit!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: That was all he had time to scream before oblivion took him from behind. Far above and to one side Blue Leader saw John D.’s ship expand in a fiery ball. His lips may have whitened slightly. Otherwise he might as well never have seen the X-wing explode, for all the reaction he displayed. He had more important things to do.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: On the fourth moon of Yavin a spacious screen chose that moment to flicker and die, much as John D. had. Worried technicians began rushing in all directions. One turned a drawn face to Leia, theexpectant Commanders, and one tall, bronzed robot.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “The high-band receiver has failed. It will take some time to fix...”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Do the best you can,” Leia snapped. “Switch to audio only.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Someone overheard, and in seconds the room was filled with the sounds of distant battle, interspersed with the voices of those involved.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tighten it up, Blue Two, tighten it up,” Blue. Leader was saying. “Watch those towers.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Heavy fire, Boss,” came the voice of Wedge Antilles, ‘‘twenty-three degrees.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I see it. Pull in, pull in. We're picking up some interference.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I can’t believe it,” Biggs was stammering. “I’ve never seen such firepower!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Pull in, Blue Five. Pull in.” A pause, then, “Luke, do you read me? Luke?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m all right, Chief,” came Luke’s reply. “I’ve got a target. Pm going to check it out.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “There’s too much action down there, Luke,” Biggs told him. “Get out. Do you read me, Luke? Pull out.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Break off, Luke,” ordered the deeper tones of Blue Leader. “We've hit too much interference here. Luke, I repeat, break off! I can’t see him. Blue Two, can you see Blue Five?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Negative,” Wedge replied quickly. “There’s a fire zone here you wouldn’t believe. My scanner’s jammed. Blue Five, where are you? Luke, are you all tight?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “He’s gone,” Biggs started to report solemnly. Then his voice rose. “No, wait . . . there he is! Looks like a little fin damage, but the kid’s fine.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Relief swept the war room, and it was most noticeable in the face of the slightest, most beautiful Sena-tor present.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: On the battle station, troopers worn half to death or deafened by the concussion of the big guns were replaced by fresh crews. None of them had time to wonder how the battle was going, and at the moment none of them much cared, a malady shared by common soldiers since the dawn of history.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke skimmed daringly low over the station’s surface, his attention riveted on a distant metal projec-tion.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Stick close, Blue Five,” the squadron commander directed him, “Where are you going?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve picked up what looks like a lateral stabilizer,”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke replied. “I’m going to try for it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Watch yourself, Blue Five. Heavy fire in your area.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke ignored the warning as he headed the fighter Straight toward the oddly shaped protuberance. His determination was rewarded when, after saturating it with fire, he saw it erupt in a spectacular ball of superhot gas.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Got it!” he exclaimed. “Continuing south for another one.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within the rebel temple-fortress, Leia listened intently. She seemed simultaneously angry and fright-ened. Finally she tured to Threepio and muttered, “Why is Luke taking so many chances?” The tall *droid didn’t reply..

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Watch your back, Luke,” Biggs’s voice sounded over the speakers, “watch your back! Fighters above you, coming in.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Leia strained to see what she could only hear. She wasn’t alone. “Help him, Artoo,” Threepio was whispering to himself, “and keep holding on.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke continued his dive even as he looked back and spotted the object of Biggs’s concern close on his tail. Reluctantly he pulled up and away from the station surface, abandoning his target. His tormentor wasgood, however, and continued closing on him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T can’t shake him,” he reported.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something cut across the sky toward both ships. “Tm on him, Luke,” shouted Wedge Antilles. ‘Hold on.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke didn’t have to for very long. Wedge’s gunnery was precise, and the Tie fighter vanished brightly shortly thereafter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Thanks, Wedge,” Luke murmured, breathing a little more easily.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Good shooting, Wedge.” That was Biggs again. “Blue Four, I’m going in. Cover me, Porkins.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m right with you, Blue Three,” came the other pilot’s assurance.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Biggs leveled them off, let go with full weaponry. No one ever decided exactly what it was he hit, but

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: the small tower that blew up under his energy bolts was obviously more important than it looked.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A series of sequential explosions hopscotched across a large section of the battle station’s surface, leaping from one terminal to the next. Biggs had atready shot past the area of disturbance, but his companion, following slightly behind, received a full dose of what-ever energy was running wild down there.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve got a problem,” Porkins announced. “My converter’s running wild.” That was an understatement.Every instrument on his control panels had abruptly gone berserk.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Fject—eject, Blue Four,” advised Biggs. “Blue Four, do you read?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’m okay,” Porkins replied. “I can hold her.. Give me a little room to run, Biggs.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You're too low,” his companion yelled. “Pull up, pull up!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: With his instrumentation not providing proper information, and at the altitude he was traveling, Pork-ins’s ship was simple for one of the big, clumsy gun emplacements to track. It did as its designers had intended it should. Porkins’s demise was as glorious as it was abrupt.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It was comparatively quiet near the pole of the battle station. So intense and vicious had been Blue and Green squadron’s assault on the equator that Imperial resistence had concentrated there. Red Leadersurveyed the false peace with mournful satisfaction, knowing it wouldn’t last for long.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Leader, this is Red Leader,” he announced into his mike. “We're starting our attack run. The exhaust port is located and marked. No flak, no enemyfighters up here—yet. Looks like we'll get at least one smooth run at it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I copy, Red Leader,” the voice of his counterpart responded. ‘““We’ll try to keep them busy down here.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Three Y-wing fighters dropped out of the stars, diving toward the battle-station surface. At the last possible minute they swerved to dip into a deep

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: artificial canyon, one of many streaking the northern pole of the Death Star. Metal ramparts raced past on three sides of them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Leader hunted around, noticed the temporary absence of Imperial fighters. He adjusted a control and addressed his squadron.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is it, boys. Remember, when you think you’re close, go in closer before you drop that rock. Switch all power to front deflector screens—never mind what they throw at you from the side. We can’t worry about that now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Imperial crews. lining the trench rudely awoke to the fact that their heretofore ignored section of the station was coming under attack. They reacted speedily, and soon energy bolts were racing at the attackingships in a steadily increasing volume. Occasionally one would explode near’ one of the onrushing Y-wings, jostling it without real damage.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “A little aggressive, aren’t they,” Red Two reported over his mike.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Leader reacted quietly. “How many guns do you think, Red Five?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Five, known casually to most of the rebel pilots as Pops, somehow managed to make an estimate of the trench’s defenses while simultaneously piloting his fighter through the growing hail of fire. His helmet was battered almost to the point of uselessnessfrom the effects of more battles than anyone had a right to survive.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I'd say about twenty emplacements,” he finally decided, “some in the surface and some on the towers.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Leader acknowledged the information with a grunt as he pulled his computer-targeting visor down in front of his face. Explosions continued to rock the fighter. “Switch to targeting computers,” he declared,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Red Two,” came one reply, “computer Idcked in and [’'m getting a signal.” The young pilot’s rising excitement marked his reply.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But the senior pilot among all the rebels, Red Five, was expectantly cool and confident—though it didn’t

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: sound like it from what he murmured half to himself: “No doubt about it, this is going to be some trick.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Unexpectedly, all defensive fire from the surrounding emplacements ceased. An eerie quiet clung to thetrench as the. surface continued to blur past the skimming Y-wings.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What’s this?” Red Two blurted, looking around worriedly. “‘They stopped. Why?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I don’t like it,” growled Red Leader. But there was nothing to confuse their approach now, no energy bolts to avoid. ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It was Pops who was first to properly evaluate this seeming aberration on the enemy’s part. “Stabilize your rear deflectors now. Watch for enemy fighters.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You pinned it, Pops,” Red Leader admitted, studying a readout. “Here they come, Three marks at two-ten.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A mechanical voice continued to recite the shrinking distance to their target, but it wasn’t shrinking fast enough. “We’re sitting ducks down here,” he observed nervously.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We'll just have to ride it out,” the old man told them all. “We can’t defend ourselves and go for the target at the same time.” He fought down old reflexes as his own screen revealed three Tie fightersin precision formation diving almost vertically down toward them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Three-eight-one-oh-four,” Darth Vader announced as he calmly adjusted his controls. The stars whipped past behind him. “Til take them myself. Cover me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Two was the first to die, the young pilot never knowing what hit him, never secing his executioner. Despite his experience, Red Leader was onthe verge of panic when he saw his wingman dissolve in flame.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're trapped down here. No way to maneuver— trench walls are too close, We’ve got to loosen it up somehow. Got—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Stay on target,” admonished an older voice. “Stay on target.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Red Leader took Pops’s words like tonic, but it was all he could do to ignore the closing Tie fighters as the two remaining Y-wings continued to streak toward the target.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Above them, Vader permitted himself a moment of undisciplined pleasure as he readjusted his targeting "puter. The rebel craft continued to travel astraight, unevasive course. Again Vader touched finger to fire control.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something screeched in Red Leader’s helmet, and fire started to consume his instrumentation. “It’s no good,” he yelled into his pickup, “I’m hit. I'm hit... 1”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A second Y-wing exploded in a ball of vaporized metal, scattering a few solid shards of debris across the trench. This second loss proved too much even for Red Five to take. He manipulated controls, and his ship commenced rising in a slow curve out of the trench, Behind him, the lead Imperial fighter moved to follow.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Red Five to Blue Leader,” he reported. “Aborting tun under heavy fire. Tie fighters dropped on us out of nowhere. I can’t—-wait—”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Astern, a silent, remorseless enemy was touching a deadly button once more. The first bolts struck just as Pops had risen high enough to commence evasive action. But he had pulled clear a few seconds too late. ;

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: One energy beam seared his port engine, igniting gas. within. The engine blew apart, taking controls and stabilizing elements with it. Unable to compensate, the out-of-control Y-wing began a long, gracefulplunge toward the station surface.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you all right, Red Five?” a troubled voice called over the intership system.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Lost Tiree . . . lost Dutch,” Pops explained slowly, tiredly. “They drop in behind you, and you can’t maneuver in the trench. Sorry . . . it’s your baby now. So long, Dave... .”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: It was the last message of many from a veteran.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Leader forced a crispness he didn’t feel into his voice as he tried to shunt aside the death of his old friend. “Blue boys, this is Blue Leader. Rendezvous at mark six point one. All wings report in.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Leader, this is Blue Ten. I copy.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Two here,” Wedge acknowledged. “Coming toward you, Blue Leader.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was also waiting his tum to report when something beeped on his control board. A glance backward confirmed the electronic waming as he spotted an Imperial fighter slipping in behind him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is Blue Five,” he declared, his ship wobbling as he tried to lose the Tie fighter. “I have a problem here. Be right with you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He sent his ship into a steep dive toward the metal surface, then cut sharply up to avoid a burst of defensive fire from emplacements below. Neither maneu-ver shook his pursuit.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T see you, Luke,” came a reassuring call from Biggs. “Stay with it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked above, below, and to the sides, but there was no sign of his friend. Meanwhile, energy bolts from his trailing assailant were passing uncomfortably close. ,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blast it, Biggs, where are you?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something appeared, not to the sides or behind, but almost directly in front of him. It was bright and moving incredibly fast, and then it was firing just above him. Taken completely by surprise, the Imperial fighter came apart just as its pilot realizedwhat had happened.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke turned for the rendezvous mark as Biggs shot past overhead. “Good move, Biggs. Fooled me, too.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Pm just getting started,” his friend announced as he twisted his ship violently to avoid the fire from below. He hove into view over Luke’s shoulder and executed a victory roll. “Just point me at the target.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Back alongside Yavin’s indifferent bulk, Dodonna finished an intense discussion with several of his prin-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: cipal advisors, then moved to the long-range transmitter.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Leader, this is Base One. Double-check your own attack prior to commencement. Have your wingmen hold back and cover for you. Keep half yourgroup out of range to make the next run.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Copy, Base One,” the response came. “Blue Ten, Blue Twelve, join with me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two ships leveled off to flank the squadron commander. Blue Leader checked them out. Satisfiedthat they were positioned properly for the attack run, he set the group to follow in case they should fail.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Five, this is Blue Leader. Luke, take Blue Two and Three with you. Hold up here out of their fire and wait for my signal to start your own run.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Copy, Blue Leader,” Luke acknowledged, trying to slow his heart slightly. “May the force be with you. Biggs, Wedge, let’s close it up.” Together, the three fighters assumed a tight formation high above the firefight still raging between other rebel craft of Green and Yellow squadrons and the imperial gunners below.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The horizon flip-flopped ahead of Blue Leader as he commenced his approach to the station surface. “Blue Ten, Blue Twelve, stay back until we spot those fighters, then cover me.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: All three X-wings reached the surface, leveled off, then arced into the trench. His wingmen dropped farther and farther behind until Blue Leader was seemingly alone in the vast gray chasm.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: No defensive fire greeted him as he raced toward the distant target. He found himself looking around nervously, checking and rechecking the same instruments.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This doesn’t look right,” he found himself muttering.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Ten sounded equally concerned. “You should be able to pick up the target by now.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “J know. The disruption down here is unbelicv-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: able. I think my instruments are off. Is this the right trench?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Suddenly; intense streaks of light began to shoot close by as the trench defenses opened up. Near misses shook the attackers. At the far end of the trench a huge tower dominated the metal ridge, vomiting enormous amounts of energy at the nearingships.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s not going to be easy with that tower up there,” Blue Leader declared grimly. “Stand by to close up a little when I tell you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Abruptly the energy bolts ceased and all was silent and dark in the trench once again. “This is it,” Blue Leader announced, trying to locate the attack from above that had to be coming. “Keep your eyes open for those fighters.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “All short- and long-range scopes are blank,” Blue Ten reported tensely. “Too much interference here. Blue Five, can you see them from where you are?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke’s attention was riveted to the surface of the station. “No sign of— Wait!” Three rapidly moving points of light caught his eye. “There they are. Coming in point three five.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Ten turned and looked in the indicated direction. Sun bounced off stabilizing fins as the Tie fight-ers looped downward. “T see them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s the right trench, all right,” Blue Leader exclaimed as his tracking scope suddenly began a steadybeeping. He adjusted his targeting instrumentation, pulling the visor down over his eyes. “I’m almost in range. Targets ready . . . coming up. Just hold them off me for a few seconds—keep ’em busy.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: But Darth Vader was already setting his own fire control as he dropped like a stone toward the trench. “Close up the formation. [Ul take them myself.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Twelve went first, both engines blown. A slight deviation in flight path and his ship slammed into the trench wall. Blue Ten slowed and accelerated, bobbed drunkenly, but could do little within the confines of those metal walls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I can’t hold them long, You’d better fire while you can, Blue Leader—we’re closing on you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The squadron commander was wholly absorbed in lining up two circles within his targeting visor. “We're almost home. Steady, steady. . .”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Ten glanced around frantically. “They’re right behind me!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Leader was amazed at how calm he was. The targeting device was partly responsible, enabling him to concentrate on tiny, abstract images to the exclusion of all else, helping him to shut out the restof the inimical universe.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Almost there, almost there . . .” he whispered. Then the two circles matched, turned red, and a steady buzzing sounded in his helmet. “Torpedoes away, torpedoes away.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Immediately after, Blue Ten let his own missiles loose. Both fighters pulled up sharply, just clearing the end of the trench as several explosions billowed in their wake.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It’s a hit! We’ve done it!” Blue Ten shouted hysterically.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Blue Leader’s reply was thick with disappointment. “No, we haven’t. They didn’t go in. They justexploded on the surface outside the shaft.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Disappointment killed them, too, as they neglected to watch behind them. Three pursuing Imperial fighters continued up out of the fading light from thetorpedo explosions. Blue Ten fell to Vader’s precision fire, then the Dark Lord changed course slightly to fall in behind the squadron commander.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tl take the last one,” he announced coldly. “You two go back.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke was trying to pick the assault team out of the glowing gases below when Blue Leader’s voice sounded over the communicator.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: ‘Blue Five, this is Blue Leader. Move into position, Luke. Start your attack run—stay low and waituntil you’re right on top of it. Its not going to be easy.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you all right?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They’re on top of me—but I'll shake them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Blue Five to Blue pack,” Luke ordered, “et’s go!” The three ships peeled off and plunged toward the trench sector.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Meanwhile Vader finally succeeded in hitting his quarry, a glancing bolt that nonetheless started small, intense explosions in one engine. Its R-2 unit scrambled back toward the damaged wing and struggledto repair the crippled power plant.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “R-2, shut off the main feed to number-one starboard engine,” Blue Leader directed quietly, staringresignedly at instruments which were running impossibilities. “Hang on tight, this could get rough.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke saw that Blue Leader was in trouble. “We’re right above you, Blue Leader,” he declared. “Turn to point oh five, and we'll cover for you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I’ve lost my upper starboard engine,” came the reply.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We'll come down for you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Negative, negative. Stay there and get set up for your attack run.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You're sure you're all right?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T think so... Stand by for a minute.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Actually, it was somewhat less than a minute before Blue Leader’s gyrating X-wing plowed into the surface of the station.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke watched the huge explosion dissipate below him, knowing without question its cause, sensing fully for the first time the helplessness of his situaton. “We just lost Blue Leader,” he murmured absently, not particularly caring if his mike picked up the somber announcement.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: On Yavin Four, Leia Organa rose from her chair and nervously began pacing the room. Normally perfect nails were now jagged and uneven from nervouschewing. It was the only indication of physical unease. The anxiety visible in her expression was farmore revealing of her feelings, an anxiety and worry

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: that filled the war room on the announcement of Blue Leader’s death.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Can they go on?” she finally asked Dodonna.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The general replied with gentle resolve. “They must.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “But we've lost so many. Without Blue or Red Leader, how will they regroup?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dodonna was about to reply, but held his words as more critical ones sounded over the speakers.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Close it up, Wedge,” Luke was saying, thousands of kilometers away. “Biggs, where are you?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Coming in right behind you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Wedge replied soon after. “Okay, Boss, we're in position.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Dodonna’s gaze went to Leia. He looked concerned.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The three X-wings moved close together high above the battle station’s surface. Luke studied his instruments and fought irritably with one control that appeared to be malfunctioning.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Someone’s voice sounded in his ears. It was a youngold voice, a familiar voice: calm, content, confident,and reassuring—a voice he had listened to intently on the desert of Tatooine and in the guts of the station below, once upon a time.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Trust your feelings, Luke,” was all the Kenobilike voice said.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke tapped his helmet, unsure whether he had heard anything or not. This was no time for introspection. The steely horizon of the station tilted be-hind him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Wedge, Biggs, we’re going in,” he told his wingmen. “We'll go in full speed. Never mind finding thetrench and then accelerating. Maybe that will keep those fighters far enough behind us.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We'll stay far enough back to cover you,” Biggs declared. “At that speed will you be able to pull out in time?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Are you kidding?” Luke sneered playfully as they began their dive toward the surface. “It'll be just like Beggars Canyon back home.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tm right with you, boss,” noted Wedge, emphasizing the title for the first time. “Let’s go. . .”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: At high speed the three slim fighters charged the glowing surface, pulling out after the last moment. Luke skimmed so close over the station hull that the tip of one wing grazed a protruding antenna, sending metal splinters flying. Instantly they were en-veloped in a meshwork of energy bolts and explosive projectiles. It intensified as they dropped down into the trench.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We seem to have upset them,” Biggs chortled, treating the deadly display of energy as though it were all a show being put on for their amusement.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “This is fine,’ Luke commented, surprised at the clear view ahead. “I can see everything.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Wedge wasn’t quite as confident as he studied his own readouts. “My scope shows the tower, but I can’t make out the exhaust port. It must be awfully small. Are you sure the computer can target it?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “It better,” Biggs muttered.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke didn’t offer an evaluation—he was too busy holding a course through the turbulence produced by exploding bolts. Then, as if on command, the defensive fire ceased. He glanced around and up for sign of the expected Tie fighters, but saw nothing,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: His hand went to drop the targeting visor into position, and for just a moment he hesitated. Then heswung it down in front of his eyes. “Watch yourselves,” he ordered his companions.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “What about the tower?” Wedge asked worriedly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “You worry about those fighters,” Luke snapped. “T’ll worry about the tower.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: They rushed on, closing on the target every second. Wedge stared upward, and his gaze suddenly froze. “Here they come—oh point three.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader was setting his controls when one of his wingmen broke attack silence. “They're making their approach too fast—they’ll never get out in time.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Stay with them,” Vader commanded.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “They’re going too fast to get a fix,” his other pilot announced with certainty.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader studied several readouts and found that his sensors confirmed the other estimates, “They'll still have to slow down before they reach that tower.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke contemplated the view in his targeting visor. “Almost home.” Seconds passed and the twin circlets achieved congruence, His finger convulsed on the firing control. “Torpedoes away! Pull up, pull up.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Two powerful explosions rocked the trench, striking harmlessly far to one side of the minute opening.Three Tie fighters shot out of the rapidly dissipating fireball, closing on the retreating rebels. “Take them,” Vader ordered softly.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke detected the pursuit at the same time as his companions. “Wedge, Biggs, split up—it’s the only way we'll shake them.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The three ships dropped toward the station, then abruptly raced off in three different directions. All three Tie fighters turned and followed Luke.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Vader fired on the crazily dodging ship, missed, and frowned to himself. “The force is strong with this one. Strange. Pll take him myself.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke darted between defensive towers and wove a tight path around projecting docking bays, all to no avail. A single remaining Tie fighter stayed close behind. An energy bolt nicked one wing, close by an en-gine. It started to spark irregularly, threateningly. Luke fought to compensate and retain full control.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Still trying to shake his persistent assailant, he dropped back into a trench again. “I’m hit,” he announced, “but not bad. Artoo, see what you can dowith it.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: The tiny ’droid unlocked himself and moved to work on the damaged engine as energy bolts flashed by dangerously close. “Hang on back there,” Luke counseled the Artoo unit as he worked a path around projecting towers, the fighter spinning and twisting tightly through the topography of the station. ,

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Fire remained intense as Luke randomly changed

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: direction and speed. A series of indicators on the control panel slowly changed color; thzee vital gaugesrelaxed and returned to where they belonged.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “I think you've got it, Artoo,” Luke told him gratefully. “I think—there, that’s it. Just try to lock it downso it can’t work loose again.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Artoo beeped in reply while Luke studied the whirling panorama behind and above them. “I think we've lost those fighters, too. Blue group, this is Blue Five. Are you clear?” He manipulated several controls and the X-wing shot out of the trench, still followed by emplacement fire.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “’'m up here waiting, Boss,” Wedge announced from his position high above the station. “I can’t see you.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Tm on my way. Blue Three, are you clear? Biggs?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “T’ve had some trouble,” his friend explained, ““‘but I think [ Jost him.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Something showed again, damnably, on Biggs’s screen. A glance behind showed the Tie fighter that had been chasing him for the past several minutes dropping in once more behind him. He swung down toward the station again.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Nope, not yet,” Biggs told the others. “Hold on, Luke. Pll be right there.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: A thin, mechanical voice sounded over the speakers. “Hang on, Artoo, hang on!” Back at the temple headquarters, Threepio turned away from the curious hu-man faces which had tured to stare at him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: As Luke soared high above the station another X~- wing swung in close to him. He recognized Wedge’s ship and began hunting around anxiously for his friend.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're goin’ in, Biggs—join up. Biggs, are you all right? Biggs!” There was no sign of the other fighter. “Wedge, do you see him anywhere?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within the transparent canopy of the fighter. bobbing close by, a helmeted head shook slowly. “Noth-ing,” Wedge told him over the communicator. “Wait a little longer. He’ll show.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke looked around, worried, studied several in-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: struments, then came to a decision. “We can’t wait; we've got to go now. I don’t think he made it.” |

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Hey, you guys,” a cheerful voice demanded to know, “what are you waiting for?”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Luke turned sharply to his right, in time to see another ship racing past and slowing slightly ahead of him, “Don’t ever give up on old Biggs,” the intercom directed as the figure in the X-wing ahead looked back at them.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Within the central contro] room of the battle station, a harried officer rushed up to a figure studyingthe great battle screen and waved a handful of printouts at him.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Sir, we've completed an analysis of their attack plan. There is a danger. Should we break off the engagement or make plans to evacuate? Your ship isstanding by.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Govemor Tarkin turned an incredulous gaze on the officer, who shrank back. “Evacuate!” he roared. “At our moment of triumph? We are about to destroy the last remnants of the Alliance, and you call for evacuation? You overestimate their chances badly . . . Now,get out!”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Overwhelmed by the Governor’s fury, the subdued officer tured and retreated from the room.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “We're going in,” Luke declared as he commenced his dive toward the surface. Wedge and Biggs followed just aft.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: “Let’s go—Luke,” a voice he had heard before sounded inside his head. Again he tapped his helmet and looked around. It sounded as if the speaker were standing just behind him. But there was nothing, only silent meta] and nonverbal instrumentation, Puzzled, Luke turned back to his controls.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Once more, energy bolts reached out for them, passing harmlessly on both sides as the surface of the battle station charged up into his face. But the defensive fire wasn’t the cause of the renewed trem-

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: bling Luke suddenly experienced. Several critical gauges were beginning their swing back into the danger zone again.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: He leaned toward the pickup. “Artoo, those stabilizizing elements must have broken loose again. See ifyou can’t lock it back down—l’ve got to have full control.”

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Ignoring the bumpy ride, the energy beams and explosions lighting space around him, the little robot moved to repair the damage.

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: Additional, tireless explosions continued to buffet the three fighters as they dropped into the trench. Biggs and Wedge dropped behind to cover for Luke as he reached to pull down the targeting visor. —

title: Star Wars
Author: George Lucas
paragraph: For the second time a peculiar hesitation swept through him.
